Name: The Lura Project
Desc: An extendable, simple and stateless high-performance API Gateway framework designed for both cloud-native and on-prem setups.
Supported Request Formats: JSON, Text, URI Query String/CRUD, XML

Name: Hanami
Desc:
The Hanami Ruby Framework is a minimal, extremely fast, and lightweight framework for HTTP APIs. Usage includes the well known Hanami routing syntax and a new block syntax. If a developer passes a Ruby block to the route definition, it will be evaluated when an incoming HTTP request matches that route.
hanami-api is simple, low risk, very performant way to try Hanami and build a Ruby stack. It's a mini framework to build HTTP APIs and microservices.

Name: Laravel
Desc: The Laravel PHP Framework in version 7 has been released. New features include:

Name: Spring Framework
Desc: Spring is a powerful open source, loosely coupled, light weight, java based application framework meant for reducing the complexity of developing enterprise level applications. This framework is also called as the "framework of frameworks" as spring provides support to various other important frameworks like JSF, Hibernate, Structs, EJB etc.

Name: Ravel Node.js Framework
Desc: The Ravel Node.js Framework assists in application development. It provides architecture, API documentation, deployment, and scaling as resources.

Name: Jose JavaScript Framework
Desc: Jose Framework means Javascript Object Signing and Encryption. With the API, developers can authenticate data between parties through OAuth models. Jason Web Token and Jason Web Encryption are available as authorization methods.

Name: ComposerJS Framework
Desc: ComposerJS is a framework for building client and server RESTful application programming interfaces. It provides a way to build professional RESTful API services with enterprise features that easily extend to provide additional capability. This includes features such as; it is built on OpenAPI, provides global configuration, has a built in ORM layer and more. Composer projects start with an OpenAPI specification file and leverage JSON Web Tokens for user authentication.

Name: FastAPI Python Framework
Desc: The FastAPI Python Framework builds APIs. With the key features, developers could develop faster, reduce errors, receive editor support, minimize code duplication, use interactive documentation, and use JSON schemas.

Name: Kivy Python Framework
Desc: Kivy Python enables cross-platform OpenGL ES 2 functionalities in multi touch applications. The codebase allows for Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, and iOS integrations. Kivy offers more than 20 widgets, all highly extensible. Many parts are written in C using Cython, and tested with regression tests.

Name: Chancla.io Java Framework
Desc:
Chancla.io - Hyper Agile API Development Platform
With Chancla.io, software developers may rapidly develop APIs that integrate with third-party services, such as, MongoDB (mLab.com), Redis (redislabs.com), and Amazon Aurora to name a few.
Software developers, of all skill levels, are amazed how effortlessly they are able to build and deploy APIs with Chancla.io.

Name: Astera Centerprise .NET Framework
Desc: The Astera Centerprise .NET Framework assists in data integration for business applications. Centerprise aims to ease the use of Microsoft .NET APIs.

Name: Yabeda Ruby Framework
Desc: The Yabeda Ruby Framework is a Ruby instrumentation framework that makes it easier for developers to monitor their Ruby applications. This framework works with Rails, Sidekiq, and Prometheus.

Name: Planaria JavaScript Framework
Desc: The Planaria Framework allows you to build a server-less application, and run a specialized Planaria backend as a service plus more. Planaria is a JavaScript framework that is containerized as an API Microservice and powered by Bitcoin.

Name: Google AMP JavaScript Framework
Desc: AMP is a JavaScript web component framework to create user-first; websites, stories, ads and emails. Google organizes information and makes it accessible for products and platforms for Search, Maps, Gmail, Android, Google Play, Chrome and YouTube.

Name: Hapi.js
Desc: Hapi.js is a configuration-centric framework that allows developers to reuse application logic in a "highly modular and prescriptive approach". Hapi.js offers built-in support for input validation, caching, authentication, and others. This framework is used to build enterprise-quality web applications and services.

Name: dotConnect ADO.NET Data Providers Framework
Desc: The dotConnect ADO.NET Data Providers Framework offers a data connectivity service designed to build data-related applications. This framework integrates with high performance data providers for the major databases and popular cloud applications. The dotConnect ADO.NET Data Providers Framework supports LINQ to entities and entity SQL, Entity Framework Canonical Functions, dynamic database creation and deletion, and several database-specific features such as stored procedures. Additionally, the dotConnect ADO.NET Data Providers Framework provides wide support for database types including Oracle CURSORs and SDO_GEOMETRY.

Name: Webix Jet
Desc: Webix Jet is a micro framework for Webix UI-based single-page applications that work with big amounts of data. Webix Jet allows you to create flexible, easily maintainable apps, where data and visual presentations are clearly separated, interface elements can be easily combined and reused, all parts can be developed and tested separately - all with minimal code footprint. It has a ready to use solution for all kinds of tasks, from simple admin pages to fully-fledged apps with multiple locales, customizable skins, and user access levels.

Name: ThinkGeo .NET Framework
Desc: The ThinkGeo .NET Framework allows developers to build their own .NET mapping applications for mobile, desktop, and web platforms. ThinkGeo provides a suite of GIS tools that includes vector and imagery maps, routing, geocoding, and elevation. These tools are available in three versions: an online cloud server with a RESTful API, an on-premises version that runs on Windows or Linux, or as objects that can ship to a desktop application royalty-free.

Name: RadiJS JavaScript Framework
Desc: The RadiJS JavaScript Framework is a high-speed, minimal application development interface. The framework draws its high-speed credential from the absence of doffing algorithms or virtual doms.

Name: LabStack Echo Go Framework
Desc: The LabStack Echo Go Framework provides a high-performance golang platform. The framework supports the construction of scalable RESTful APIs.

Name: Ghost Division OSINT Python Framework
Desc:
The Ghost Division OSINT Python Framework performs various techniques on Companies, People, Phone Number, Bitcoin Addresses, aggregating raw data, and giving data in multiple formats.
Linked to the

Name: Magic xpa Web Application Framework
Desc:
Magic Software's Magic xpa Web Application Framework allows you to easily create apps with AngularJS via Magic, HTML and CSS.
The xpa Web Application Framework is used with Magic Studio to define your business logic and easily generate Angular code via one-click using the Magic Converter. This creates ready-to-use AngularJS code and is easily customizable with screens that can be updated using HTML and CSS in any design tool.
The Framework has the ability to easily create large scale apps (often a sore point when working with Angular) and boosts the speed of app development.

Name: Pure CSS Framework
Desc: The Pure CSS Framework features a modular CSS minimal interface for web applications. Its modules are equipped with a variety of styles, and form components alongside buttons, tables, responsive grids, and menus. The framework is compatible with a variety of browsers including IE 8+, iOS 6-8, and Android 4.x as well as latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, and Safari.

Name: CFPB Capital CoffeeScript Framework
Desc: The CFPB Capital CoffeeScript Framework provides a CoffeScript interface for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB).

Name: Facebook React 360 JavaScript Framework
Desc: Facebook React 360 JavaScript Framework allows you to create interactive browser-based 360˚ experiences. It is crucial for pairing powerful web APIs, such as WebGL and WebVR, with the React ecosystem, when creating apps that can be deployed across devices. Its deployment requires the onwards of NodeJS 6.0.0 and the onwards of yarn or npm 3.0.0 package managers.

Name: Jovo Node.js Framework
Desc: The Jovo Node.js Framework assists in building cross-platform Voice Apps for Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant.

Name: Amio.io Chatbot Builder JavaScript Framework
Desc: This chatbot creating framework provided by Amio reacts to Webhooks, and can be customized with NLP capabilities and analytics. Akin to the REST and Webhooks APIs, this framework supports Facebook Messenger, Viber, and SMS.

Name: Ulkit JavaScript Framework
Desc: The Ulkit JavaScript Framework provides lightweight and modular front-end interface for constructing high-speed web apps using JavaScript and CSS language platforms. Its design offers unified styles and flexible customization options as well as useful modifier classes.

Name: NativeScript
Desc:
NativeScript, by Progress Software, allows you to build cross-platform, native iOS and Android apps without web views. You can use Angular, TypeScript or modern JavaScript to get truly native UI and performance while reusing the skills and the code from your web projects. Get 100% access to native APIs via JavaScript and reuse of packages from npm, CocoaPods and Gradle. Open source and backed by Progress. NativeScript is designed to give you significant code reuse between your web and mobile tiers and gives you direct access to every native platform API.
NativeScript is free and is open source.

Name: Apache Weex JavaScript Framework
Desc: The Apache Weex VueJS Framework is a platform for constructing cross-platform user interfaces for mobile applications. Built in a design that resembles React Native, the framework simplifies the implementation of CSS, HTML, and JavaScript concepts for developing Java-based Android and Swift-based iOS mobile apps. It provides a variety of built-in components, APIs, and other useful tools. Apache Weex is still a Beta project.

Name: Just-API Node.js Framework
Desc: The Just-API Node.js Framework serves as an API tester. It supports REST, GraphQL, and HTTP-based interfaces. The test results are returned in JSON and HTML after making server calls in a YAML file.

Name: SpriteJS Framework
Desc: The SpriteJS Framework allows creating sprites for animation and video games. Tested on WebKit, Firefox, Android phones, Opera and IE9.

Name: Aegis Go Framework
Desc: The Aegis Go Framework is a serverless Golang deploy tool and framework for AWS Lambda. See original article at https://serifandsemaphore.io/build-a-serverless-api-in-seconds-with-go-c504398d86f6

Name: Bootstrap JS Framework
Desc: The Bootstrap JS Framework helps to build responsive mobile sites, thinking in scalable CSS format. The Bootstrap team invites developers to write and maintain vanilla JavaScript plugins and improving tooling processes for frontend code.

Name: ZURB Foundation JS Framework
Desc: The ZURB Foundation JS Framework aims to design responsive websites, applications, and emails. It provides semantic, readable, flexible, and customizable features.

Name: Baliba PHP Framework
Desc: The Baliba PHP Framework uses arrays, aiming to simplify API documentation writing. Instructions available in English and Haitian Creole.

Name: Orienteer Java Framework
Desc: The Orienteer Java Framework is an open source business application platform with flexible and dynamically configurable APIs.

Name: Fanout.io Python Framework
Desc: The Fanout.io Python Framework is a hybrid reverse proxy and message broker, pushing data to connected devices. Open technology runs Fanout in the cloud and servers. Developers will work with Python, C, and C++ languages by using Fanout.

Name: gSOAP C++ Framework
Desc: The gSOAP C++ Framework is a toolkit of portable C and C++ software to develop XML Web services with powerful type-safe XML data bindings. Easy-to-use code-generator tools allow to directly integrate XML data in C and C++. Serializes native application data in XML. Includes WSDL/XSD schema binding and auto-coding tools, stub/skeleton compiler. Offers robust Web server integration with Apache module and IIS extension. High-performance with XML pull parsing with schema validation. Supports XML SOAP and REST protocols, fast MIME/MTOM streaming, WS-Security, WS-Policy, WS-Discovery, WS-ReliableMessaging, WS-Addressing, XML-RPC and JSON.

Name: Graphcool
Desc:
Graphcool is an open-source backend development framework to develop and deploy production-ready GraphQL microservices. With Graphcool you can design your data model and have a production ready GraphQL API online in minutes.
The framework integrates with cloud-native serverless functions and is compatible with existing libraries and tools like GraphQL.js and Apollo Server. The framework offers an opinionated backend setup, including GraphQL database mapping, subscriptions & permission system. Graphcool comes with a CLI and a Docker-based runtime which can be deployed to any server or cloud.

Name: Bugfender Android Framework
Desc: iOS Framework and Android Library to send logs to the Bugfender cloud storage with a single API call.

Name: WavesDevKit JavaScript Framework
Desc: The WavesDevKit JavaScript Framework supports interaction with the Waves Platform. Use the framework’s Javascript platform to create transactions and access crucial Waves functions.

Name: ASP.Net Boilerplate Framework
Desc: The ASP.Net Boilerplate Framework assists to develop web application targeting localization services. Developers can build on Microsoft Studio, .NET Core, Entity, Angular, Bootstrap, Swagger, NPM, and jQuery. The framework includes an API in XML and JSON formats and sample code. To learn more, visit https://aspnetboilerplate.com/Pages/Documents/Localization

Name: Jersey Java Framework
Desc: The Jersey Framework aims to simplify RESTful services and client developments. With Jersey developers can track JAX-RS APIs using Java and Java Virtual Machine.

Name: Mobi Mobile CSS Framework
Desc: The lightweight Mobi Mobile CSS Framework provides a flexible platform for building web applications.

Name: i18next JavaScript
Desc: The i18next Framework written in JavaScript provides internationalization, localization, and translation features. Plugins allow detecting languages, load translations, cache translations.

Name: A-Frame JavaScript Virtual Reality Framework
Desc: A-Frame Virtual Reality JavaScript Framework allows you to build virtual reality (VR) experiences. Mozilla is credited for introducing A-Frame as a simple but powerful solution for developing VR content. The framework’s documentation provides various examples of its usage.

Name: Sibers PHP Framework
Desc: The Sibers PHP Framework helps to create API projects, allowing developers to design data models, interact with a REST API, and use JSON-LD, Hydra, HAL, YAML, JSON, XML and CSV as formats.
Supported Request Formats: CSV, HAL, JSON, JSON-LD, XML, YAML
Supported Response Formats: CSV, HAL, JSON, JSON-LD, XML, YAML

Name: Uber LumaGL JavaScript Framework
Desc: The Uber LumaGL JavaScript Framework is a browser-based data visualization solution. Its lumaGL-provided building blocks are equipped with the user-friendly webGL2 feature for enhancing data visualizations and computations on browsers.

Name: Grd Flexbox CSS Framework by Shogo Sensui
Desc: The Grd Flexbox CSS Framework by Shogo Sensui allows you to create CSS applications using Flexbox.

Name: MUI Material Design CSS Framework
Desc: The MUI Material Design CSS Framework is a lightweight builder platform that prescribes to Google’s Material Design guidelines. Its fast, small, and user friendly design guarantees quality results. It features small footprint (mui.min.css – 66K, mui.min), responsive grid for implementing mobile-friendly sites, and customizable CSS library as well as JS and email libraries. The framework supports the onwards of IE10, iOS 6, and latest Chrome, Firefox, and Safari browsers.

Name: Milligram CSS Framework
Desc: The Milligram CSS Framework supports the development of design applications. Its design simplifies style setups and expedites app development.

Name: Spectre CSS Framework by Yan Zhu
Desc: The Spectre CSS Framework by Yan Zhu provides a simple platform for implementing CSS design concepts. The framework features modern base styles and responsive layout system as well as CSS components and utilities. Install the framework manually or deploy it using npm, Yarn, or Bower.

Name: Strapi Content Management NodeJS Framework
Desc: The Strapi NodeJS Content Management Framework simplifies the development of powerful CMS APIs. The framework features headless-CMS.

Name: Nozzle React Static JavaScript Framework
Desc: The Nozzle React-Static JavaScript Framework allows you to construct applications using the React platform. The framework supports the development of static-progressive websites and react applications. Use the framework to interact with different platforms of the React ecosystem including CSS-in-JS libraries, GraphQL, and Redux.

Name: Intercellular Cell JavaScript Framework
Desc: The Intercellular Cell JavaScript Framework is self-constructing web application. It is powered by a self-driving DOM.

Name: Squarespace CSS Dossier Framework by Squarespace
Desc: The Squarespace CSS Dossier Framework by Squarespace is a template for grid-style blogs. The framework’s functional attributes include grid-style blog list page offering a variety of layout options and item header for fullscreen blog, among others. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers are required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

Name: Recon-ng Python Framework
Desc: The Recon-ng Python Framework provides independent modules, database interaction, built in convenience functions, interactive help, and command completion. Recon-ng offers an environment in which open source web-based reconnaissance can be conducted quickly and thoroughly.

Name: Socket.io
Desc:
Socket.io is a NodeJS realtime framework server. Socket.IO is composed of two parts: a server that integrates with or mounts onto the NodeJS HTTP server and a client library that loads on the browser side. It allows you to
send and receive any events, with any data. It uses objects that can be encoded as JSON, as well as binary data.

Name: Sunrise Shop Framework Java Sample Code by Commercetools
Desc: The Sunrise Shop Framework Java Sample Code by Commercetools provides a live demo to demonstrate eCommerce implementation. By viewing the course with right click, developers will know how the framework was integrated into a clothing store.

Name: Betfair Cougar Java Framework by Betfair
Desc: The Betfair Cougar Java Framework by Betfair simplifies the development of network exposed service interfaces on Java platforms. The framework’s current version is 3.2.1.

Name: Yoctol Bottender JavaScript Framework
Desc: Use the Yoctol Bottender JavaScript Framework to develop cross-platform bots for Slack, Messenger, LINE, and other platforms. The framework is written in ES6 and ES7 syntax and provides support for async await function.

Name: BloodMagic Objective-C Framework by Railsware
Desc: The BloodMagic Objective-C Framework by Railsware provides a platform for creating custom property attributes en building iOS applications.

Name: Herb Daily Marley Ruby Framework by Herb Daily
Desc: Marley enables RESTful web services and applications. Marley consists of a simple Rack application, a default controller for ORM classes, a Sequel-based plugin system, reusable resource sets, and JSON data support. The current version is 0.8.3.

Name: Javalin Kotlin Framework
Desc: The Javalin Kotlin Framework serves the lightweight REST API. An example is available at https://javalin.io/tutorials/simple-kotlin-example

Name: Tailwind CSS Framework
Desc: The Tailwind CSS Framework is a utility-first platform for rapid UI development.

Name: Bulma CSS Framework by Jeremy Thomas
Desc: The Bulma CSS Framework by Jeremy Thomas is a CSS application development platform that is based on Flexbox. The framework’s documentation provides the installation paths for NPM, Yarn, or Bower. It supports the latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Opera, and Safari browsers.

Name: Javalin Java Framework
Desc: The Javalin Java Framework serves the lightweight REST API. A getting started guide is available at https://javalin.io/documentation#getting-started

Name: Fastify NodeJS Framework
Desc: Fastify is a fast and low overhead web framework for NodeJS. The Fastify NodeJS Framework provides RESTful tools for interacting with the Fastify platform. It optimizes developer experience with minimum overhead and powerful plugin architecture.

Name: Zeit JavaScript NextJS Framework
Desc: The Zeit JavaScript NextJS Framework is designed for server-rendered React apps. Setup requires npm installation.

Name: Accenture Alexia NodeJS Framework by Accenture
Desc: Alexia enables the creation of Amazon Echo skills using NodeJS. This framework handles Amazon Echo requests which are translated into intents for application processing. Alexia can control the flow of intents by using transitions. Localization is provided by i18next. The current version is 2.4.0.

Name: Volt Ruby Framework by Volt
Desc: Volt offers a framework for building data rich web applications where Ruby code runs on both the server and the client. Volt features automated DOM updating, and URL page state storage. The current version is 0.9.7.

Name: ZfrPusher Zend PHP Framework by Zfr
Desc: The ZfrPusher PHP Zend Framework by Zfr is a module that is anchored on the ZfrPusher. The framework communicates with the Pusher HTTP API. Its deployment requires PHP 5.3, Zend Framework 2, and the ZfrPusher platform.

Name: Ramaze Ruby Framework by Ramaze
Desc: Ramaze offers a modular web application framework that features an MVC pattern out of the box. Ruby 1.8+ is required.

Name: Pakyow Ruby Framework by Pakyow
Desc: Pakyow offers a progressive platform for building web applications with several features such as auto-updating views, and rapid prototyping. The current version is 0.11.3.

Name: ReSTbasis
Desc: ReSTbasis is a REST web development framework based on W3C standards, and MVC architectural patterns. ReSTbasis provides the blueprints that can produce high performing single page applications with integrated security. Software requirements include Java, NodeJS, npm or yarn, and Grunt. ReSTbasis offers a 90 day free trial version.

Name: Trailblazer Ruby Framework by Trailblazer
Desc: Trailblazer is a business logic framework with an object-oriented architecture. Trailblazer is a thin layer on top of Rails that offers new high-level abstractions and enforces encapsulation. The current version is 2.0.7.

Name: Squarespace CSS Doncab Framework by Squarespace
Desc: The Squarespace CSS Doncab Framework by Squarespace provides unique gallery layouts for projects. It is functionally designed to provide “Full Width, Half Width, Alternating Width, and Grid layout options for Index Collections.” The framework also features page transition animations and AJAX loaede pages. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers re required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

Name: Squarespace CSS Endeavor Framework by Squarespace
Desc: The Squarespace CSS Endeavor Framework by Squarespace features a hover-activated index gallery. Some of its functional features include index gallery and gallery-style navigation as well as overlay style introductions for pages or collections and SVG UI icons with weights. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers re required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

Name: Squarespace CSS Wright Framework by Squarespace
Desc: The Squarespace CSS Wright Framework by Squarespace is a multi-purpose template framework for Squarespace. Some of the framework’s functional attributes include parallax scrolling images and background video, flexible header and mobile bars featuring interchangeable and movable components, and SVG UI icons with adjustable weights, among others. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers re required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

Name: NewTek ofxNDI C++ Framework by Lynn Jarvis
Desc: The ofxNDI C++ Framework by Lynn Jarvis is an addon that facilitates the conveyance of images over a network using the NewTek Network Device Protocol.

Name: Atlassian Connect Spring Boot Java Framework by Atlassian
Desc: The Atlassian Connect Spring Boot Java Framework by Atlassian allows developers to create Atlassian Connect Add-ons for JIRA. Some of the framework’s dependencies include Spring Framework, Spring Boot, Spring Data, and Spring Security.

Name: Vue.JS JavaScript Framework by Vue.JS
Desc: The Vue.JS JavaScript Framework by Vue.JS builds user interfaces on the web. According to the Vue, the core features include declarative rendering with a plain JavaScript object based reactivity system, component-oriented development style with tooling support, and flexible transition effect system. It only supports ES5-compliant browsers.

Name: Squarespace CSS Bureau Framework by Squarespace
Desc: The Squarespace CSS Bureau Framework by Squarespace features grid-based, magazine-style blog. Some of the framework’s functional features include SVG UI icons with weights and blog with three different styles – that is, auto-columns, baseline, and top-aligned. It also provides a two-column overlay style navigation panel and related posts supports among other features. A Node Package Manager allows developers to initiate dependency management and run build scripts. The framework is a proprietary platform and developers are required to comply with the Squarespace TOS when using it.

Name: Atlassian Connect Express NodeJS Framework by Atlassian
Desc: The Atlassian Connect Express NodeJS Framework by Atlassian provides developers the tools for building Atlassian Connect-anchored Add-ons using the NodeJS language. These Add-ons facilitate the extension of Atlassian applications across standard web protocols and APIs.

Name: Phoenix
Desc: The Phoenix Framework in Elixir language allows the creation of interactive experiences across browsers, native mobile apps, and embedded devices in real time. With the framework, developers can develop APIs and HTML 5 applications.

Name: OANDA REST Scala Framework by Michael Silbermann
Desc: This is a Scala Backtesting and Live Trading Framework built on top of Akka/Spray. The framework can be useful for back/live testing automated trading strategies using Oanda's REST API. The API allows you to develop trading strategies and automate your trading experience. OANDA provides FX & CFD trading, exchange rates data and corporate FX payments.

Name: Rack Ruby Framework by Rack
Desc: Rack provides a minimal, modular, and adaptable interface for developing web applications in Ruby. By wrapping HTTP requests and responses in the simplest way possible, it unifies and distills the API for web servers, web frameworks, and software in between (the so-called middleware) into a single method call.

Name: Meteor JavaScript Framework by Meteor
Desc: The Meteor JavaScript Framework by Meteor helps to develop web and mobile applications. It uses a server to send data, offering full stack reactivity, enabling user interface development.

Name: Backbone.JS JavaScript Framework by Backbone
Desc: The Backbone.JS JavaScript Framework by Backbone provides structure to web apps by offering models, views, collections, and events. It connects to a developer's API in REST architecture and JSON format.

Name: Sunrise Shop Framework iOS Sample Code by Commercetools
Desc: The Sunrise Shop Framework iOS Sample Code by Commercetools presents how to use the Sunrise framework to run an eCommerce project.

Name: Wave PHP Framework by Wave
Desc: The Wave PHP Framework by Wave helps in building applications. It is a micro-framework built considering API, that returns XML, CSV, JSON, HTML, and native PHP. It also provides support for jQuery JavaScript framework. For more features, see the documentation, available at https://www.waveframework.com/wave/doc/index.htm

Name: Silex PHP Framework by SensioLabs
Desc: The Silex PHP Framework by SensioLabs is a micro-framework for building applications that aims to be concise, extensible, and testable. It includes JSON format and HTTP methods such as GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, or OPTIONS. It was created by SensioLabs, the developers behind Symfony.

Name: CodeIgniter PHP Framework by CodeIgniter
Desc: The CodeIgniter PHP Framework by CodeIgniter helps to develop web applications. It supports compatibility, no restrictive coding rules, and no configuration.

Name: Lumen PHP Framework by Laravel
Desc: The Lumen PHP Framework by Laravel is a micro-framework for building the web that can be upgraded to the full Laravel. It aims to be fast with almost zero configuration. Additional Laravel features are available at https://laravel.com/

Name: Limonade PHP Framework by Limonade
Desc: The Limonade PHP Framework by Limonade is a micro-framework that assists in web development and prototyping, aiming to be simple, lightweight, and flexible. Inspired in Sinatra, Camping, and Orbit.

Name: Kanary Kotlin Framework by Kanary
Desc: The Kanary Kotlin Framework by Kanary helps in building applications that feature RESTful APIs. It supports routing, controllers, HTTP helpers, asynchronous middleware, one-liners, and action lifecycle callback methods. For additional information, contact iyanuadelekan@gmail.com

Name: Ember JavaScript Framework by Ember
Desc: The Ember JavaScript Framework by Ember assists in developing applications with user interactions. It supports Ember CLI toolkit, routing, template engine, data layer, and Ember inspector.

Name: SocketCluster Node.js Framework by SocketCluster
Desc: SocketCluster is an open source, real time Node.js framework that is optimized to run and autoscale on Kubernetes. It can scale vertically across multiple CPU cores and horizontally across machines and instances. SocketCluster supports both direct client-server communication and group communication.

Name: Vapor
Desc: Vapor is a web framework and server for Swift. It works on macOS and Ubuntu and provides a foundation for your next website or API.

Name: Sails.JS JavaScript Framework by Sails.JS
Desc: The Sails.JS JavaScript Framework by Sails.JS is a model view controller in real time that assists in application development. It is built on Node.js, Express, and Socket.io. According to Sails, it officially supports databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, and local memory. Community adapters include CouchDB, neDB, TingoDB, SQLite, Oracle, MSSQL, DB2, ElasticSearch, Riak, neo4j, OrientDB, Amazon RDS, DynamoDB, Azure Tables, RethinkDB and Solr. Also provides access to various 3rd-party REST APIs like Quickbooks, Yelp, and Twitter, including a configurable generic REST API adapter.

Name: Mocha.JS JavaScript Framework by Mocha.JS
Desc: The Mocha.JS JavaScript Framework by Mocha.JS helps developers to create applications, providing asynchronous testing and flexible reports. It supports browser, test coverage reporting, JavaScript API for tests, and arbitrary transpiler support in coffee-script.

Name: API Platform PHP Framework
Desc: The API Platform PHP Framework allows developers to create API-first projects. The framework can expose a REST API that works by reusing entity metadata. The resulting API uses JSON-LD, Hydra, XML, CSV, and other common data formats. API documentation is automatically generated with Swagger.

Name: Flower Power NodeJS Framework by Parrot
Desc: This NodeJS Framework is a module to build a bridge form BLE sensors and the Parrot CLOUD. It works with any BLE-equipped/BLE-dongle-equipped computers. It aims to mimic the Flower Power iOS/Android application on a RaspBerryPi and requires Node (with npm) and BLE libraries. Parrot Pots and Sensors for plants are a self-watering system to monitor your Parrot Pot's light, temperature, soil moisture and fertilizer levels in real time. It sends out customized recommendations and alerts to help you better care for your plants.

Name: Sunrise PHP Framework by commercetools
Desc: The Sunrise PHP Framework by commercetools is a resource to access eCommerce tools via API, presenting a demo with the categories of product overview, cart detail, checkout methods, my account, registration email, and store finder.

Name: Beego Framework
Desc: The Beego HTTP Framework aims to speed up the creation of Go applications. Developers can build APIs, web apps, and backend services.

Name: Sunrise Theme Java Framework by commercetools
Desc: The Sunrise Theme Java Framework by commercetools can implement eCommerce tools by interacting with the API, offering a demo with product overview, cart detail, checkout methods, my account, registration email, and store finder as available methods.

Name: Sunrise Data Java Framework by commercetools
Desc: The Sunrise Data Java Framework by commercetools assists developers in implementing eCommerce tools via API, including CVS files to import product types, categories, and products.

Name: CasperJS Framework
Desc: The CasperJS Framework allows navigating, scripting, and testing PhantomJS and SlimerJS, both scriptable web kits. It is written in JavaScript and it offers an API with JSON architecture. With Casper, developers can create scenarios and interfaces to navigate the web, allowing the framework to perform tasks as a computer user. Created by Nicolas Perriault and collaborators.

Name: Sunrise Starter Project Java Framework by commercetools
Desc: The Sunrise Starter Project Java Framework by commercetools can access eCommerce tools via API, providing preconditions, running instructions, and Heroku deployment as available resources.

Name: SlimerJS Framework
Desc: The SlimerJS Framework is available for download as a browser that developers can script. It enables to interact with a web page via an external JavaScript. Some of the benefits of Slimer aim to read and write files, load a page to evaluate content, simulate user actions such as click links and fill forms, monitoring the loading of a page, and take page screenshots. Created by developer Laurent Jouanneau and the developers' team La société Innophi.

Name: Serverless Framework
Desc: The Serverless Framework in Node.js language, assists in the development of applications that can be auto-scalable, event-driven, and executed by pay. It utilizes Amazon Web Services Lambda with the aim to produce results without the need of a server.

Name: PhantomJS Framework
Desc: The PhantomJS Framework allows to write scripts without the need to use a browser. Along with an API in JavaScript language, Phantom supports JSON, DOM handling, CSS selector, JSON, Canvas, and SVG formats. With Phantom, developers ca test websites, capture screens, automate pages, and monitor networking. Created by Ariya Hidayat, Jamie Mason, and Maurice Svay.

Name: Mockito Framework
Desc: The Mockito Framework tests Java units. Developers can declare dependencies on the library, recommending Gradle as a build system. Interactions can be verified as well as stub method calls. Use Mockito to automate tests, sustain development, and minimize defects.

Name: Guzzle PHP Framework
Desc: The Guzzle PHP Framework offers all the tools necessary for building RESTful web service clients. This Framework features PSR-7 based streams request and response bodies, persistent connections and parallel requests, plugins for OAuth and logging, and is powered by the Symfony2 EventDispatcher. Additionally, it supports both synchronous and asynchronous requests with the same interface, and client behavior constructs with a middleware system.

Name: WorkShare Ruby Framework by WorkShare
Desc: The WorkShare Ruby Framework by WorkShare helps developers to integrate file sharing features into applications. It includes functionality, configuration, and libraries.

Name: Siesta Framework for Swift and Objective-C
Desc: Siesta is a framework for writing REST clients for iOS 8+ and macOS / OS X 10.11+. It provides a client-side cache of observable models for RESTful resources in order to simplify app code. Siesta is written in Swift, but supports apps in both Swift and Objective-C. This framework requires Xcode 7 and Swift 2.0.

Name: Ruby on Rails Framework by Rails
Desc: Ruby on Rails Framework is a web framework that allows developers to construct database-supported applications as per the prescribed requirements of the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern. The knowledge of the MVC is a prerequisite for deploying the Ruby on Rails framework, considering that it splits the developer’s application into model layer, controller layer, and view layer. Whereas the model layer is the domain model that forms the backbone of the developer’s application, the controller layer processes relevant responses to inbound HTTP requests. The view layer, on the other hand, generates representations for resources related to the developer’s application.

Name: Enyo Javascript Framework
Desc: Enyo is a JavaScript framework for building native-quality HTML5 apps. It can be used to develop apps for all major platforms, including phones, tablets, PCs, and TVs. Enyo is provided for free under the Apache 2 License.

Name: Yawp Java Web Framework
Desc: The Yawp Java Web Framework in REST architecture aims to provide productivity and scalability to create APIs. Features include query API, security shields, model hooks, asynchronous pipes, Google App Engine support, and PostgreSQL JsonB as manual scaling.

Name: jQuery JavaScript Framework by The jQuery Foundation
Desc: jQuery is a JavaScript framework that aims to simplify web design. It can be used in multiple browsers - including Internet Explorer, Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Opera - to add and manage elements, events, callbacks, and more. jQuery is CSS3 compliant.

Name: Bootbox JavaScript Framework by Nick Payne
Desc: Bootbox is a JavaScript Framework for creating programmatic dialog boxes using Bootstrap modals. It removes the burden of creating, managing, and removing the required DOM elements or JS event handlers from the user. This framework is offered under the MIT License.

Name: Garage Rails Framework by Cookpad
Desc: Garage is a Ruby on Rails framework that allows developers to add RESTful hypermedia APIs to their applications. It provides a descriptive way to serve both ActiveRecord models and Ruby objects as JSON-based resources.

Name: Limoncello PHP Framework
Desc: Limoncello PHP framework is available for download and installation from Packagist. Additional models can be found on GitHub repository.

Name: Apache Mesos JavaScript Framework by Tobilg
Desc: The Apache Mesos JavaScript Framework by Tobilg provides a JavaScript language platform for constructing applications for Mesos HTTP APIs. Developers can deploy the framework in the development of applications for various APIs including Mesos Executor HTTP, Mesos Scheduler HTTP, and Mesos Operator HTTP APIs.

Name: Blueprint CSS Framework by BluePrint
Desc: Blueprint is a CSS framework that aims to provide web developers with a way to minimize design work. Blueprint's intent is to offer common CSS classes and other web design tools, so developers don't have to start from scratch. The framework proposes built-in grid layouts, typography, plugins, printing stylesheets, and IE browser compatibility while also working with most programming languages such as PHP and Ruby on Rails.

Name: Kitura
Desc: The Kitura Framework by IBM allows developers to build applications on Bluemix with the aim to interact via Mac and Linux. It is web-based written on Swift language.

Name: Hapi.js Node.js Framework
Desc: Hapi.js is a configuration-centric framework that allows developers to reuse application logic in a "highly modular and prescriptive approach". It offers built-in support for input validation, caching, authentication, and others. This framework is used to build enterprise-quality web applications and services.

Name: Strapi Node.js Framework by Strapi
Desc: The Strapi Node.js Framework by Strapi helps developers to build back end applications and services. It includes installation, link to the Strapi studio, and resources to create a project.

Name: Nette PHP Framework by Nette Foundation
Desc: The Nette PHP Framework simplifies the development of PHP websites. It fortifies the security of websites and enhances the overall performance of web development applications. The framework that is fully compatible with the PHP 7 requires the minimum of version 5.6.0 of the PHP language platform.

Name: Cistern Ruby Framework by Josh Lane
Desc: Cistern is a Ruby-based framework that was extracted from Fog. It is designed to help users build their API clients consistently and to facilitate building mock support. This framework has no dependencies.

Name: DeviantART Cocoa Framework by Sam Shull
Desc: The DeviantART Cocoa Framework by Sam Shull authenticates and uploads content to Stash, DeviantART upload and publishing platform. It includes a reference to Sparkle project, available at https://sparkle-project.org/

Name: Comic Vine Ruby SDK by Patrick Sharp
Desc: The Comic Vine Ruby SDK by Patrick Sharp interacts with the API to access comic database functionalities. It provides installation and usage.

Name: Python Eve Framework
Desc: Eve is a Python framework that allows developers to build and deploy fully-featured RESTful web services. This framework is powered by Flask, Redis, Cerberus, and Events. It offers support for both MongoDB and SQL and has been tested with Python 2.6, 2.7, 3.3, 3.4, and PyPy.

Name: Gbone JavaScript Framework by Gobhi Theivendran
Desc: The Gbone JavaScript framework written on top of Backbone, intended for building mobile JavaScript applications. The framework aims to be dependent on Backbone, Underscore, and Zepto/jQuery.

Name: Vertebrae JavaScript Framework by Bill Heaton
Desc: The Vertabrae JavaScript framework's goal is to add overall structure to Backbone.js applications. Features intended to provide for developers include: Dynamic script loading, AMD module format, dependency management, build with largely open source libraries, organize code in packages, optimize and build for one or many single page apps, host on fully cached server, e.g. no server-side scripting using only an API for data, and behaviour driven development.

Name: Backbone Faux Server JavaScript Framework by Alex Lambiris
Desc: The Backbone Faux Serve is a framework that intended for mocking up server-side persistence / processing for Backbone.js. The goal of the framework is to override Backbone's native sync by triggering invoking a route's handler by using the syncing of a Model (or Collection) and its URL alongside the sync method. When a pair forms that matches a defined route, the route's handler is invoked.

Name: CloudCMS JavaScript SDK by CloudCMS
Desc: The CloudCMS JavaScript SDK by CloudCMS integrates content management features via API. It offers content retrieval, cluster-wide caching and broadcasting, and tag processing.

Name: Electron Framework
Desc: Electron is a framework that helps developers write cross-platform desktop applications using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This framework is based on Node.js and Chromium. It is also used in the Atom editor.

Name: Recognize.IM Objective-C SDK by Alessio Bassio
Desc: Recognize.IM Objective-C SDK by Alessio Bassio interacts with the API to access image recognition capabilities, aiming to be useful in mobile integration. It includes a Cordova plugin.

Name: Lazy Bone JaveScript Framework by Break Yang
Desc: The LazyBone framework, written in JavaScript, intends to provide a platform to write simple lisp code and generating code for both client-side and server-side. The framework aims to provide features such as: Generating javascript code dynamically, built upon Backbone.js for the client as well as HTML dynamically with html-template. and provide some continuation-based syntax, which is natural in web application development in addition to other features.

Name: Luca JavaScript Framework by Jonathan Soeder
Desc: The Luca framework intends to be a component architecture framework based on Backbone.js, which aims to include many development helpers, classes, patterns, and tools needed to build scalable and clean single page applications. It uses twitter Bootstrap compatible markup and CSS naming conventions with the goal to produce styled user interfaces with JSON alone.

Name: Chalice JavaScript Framework by Shane
Desc: The Chalice JavaScript Framework intends to be a smaller framework that works on top of CoffeeScript Backbone and Node to render apps on the client and server side of applications.

Name: Cerebral JavaScript Framework by Jørn Andre Tangen
Desc: The Cerebral framework/library is meant to extend the base functionality of Backbone.js and intended to provide robust patterns of modularity, module loading, unloading and loosely coupled module communication through a pub-sub application core.

Name: Capsule JavaScript Framework by Henrik Joreteg
Desc: The Capsule JavaScript frameworks aims to be an experimental web framework for Node.js that intends to use Socket.io and Backbone.js to synchronize model state by sharing model code between the client and the server.

Name: Broad Street JavaScript Framework by Kris Range
Desc: BroadStreet framework aims to provide developers with an HTML5, Backbone.js and JQuery Control Set for mobile applications.

Name: Tres JavaScript Framework by Julio Ceasar
Desc: The Tres JavaScript frameworks aims to offer an implementation of a Backbone.js pattern, with the intention to simplify application development by giving views control over animations on the screen.

Name: Scoop.it Java Framework by Vincent Demay
Desc: The Scoop.it Java Framework by Vincent Demay interacts with the API to integrate content features into emails, blogs, and social media. Resources include installation and usage.

Name: Scoop.it PHP Framework by zenria
Desc: The Scoop.it PHP framework by zenria can access the API to integrate content features into emails, blogs, and social media. Instructions explain how to install cURL and copy configuration sample.

Name: Crossref Python SDK by Scott Chamberlain
Desc: The Crossref Python SDK by Scott Chamberlain communicates with the API to access reference search features. It includes documentation, installation, and usage.

Name: Singool.js JavaScript Framework by Fahad Ibnay Heylaal
Desc: Singool intends to be a lightweight JavaScript framework for developing single-page web applications

Name: Feathers Node.js Framework by Feathers Contributors
Desc: Feathers is a framework that enables real-time applications and REST APIs using JavaScript or TypeScript with Node.js. Feathers works with any frontend technology like React, Vue.js, Angular, Android or iOS. Feathers uses services and workflows instead of creating routes, requests or response handlers. This allows developers to work on application logic independently from how it is being accessed in order to automatically provide REST APIs, and WebSocket APIs.

Name: Hug Python Framework by Timothy Edmund Crosley
Desc: Hug is a Python Framework created by Timothy Edmund Crosley that is designed to make developing APIs in Python as simple as possible. Hug requires Python 3+ and is provided under the MIT License.

Name: Scoop.it iOS Framework by Vincent Demay
Desc: The Scoop.it iOS Framework by Vincent Demay can access the API to integrate content features into emails, blogs, and social media. Visual resources explain how to create a project using the framework.

Name: Pin Payments C# SDK by Pin Payments
Desc: The Pin Payments C# SDK by Pin Payments allows API communication to integrate credit card features into applications. An example available demonstrates a card post charge with its respective description, amount, and currency.

Name: Blue Trip CSS Framework by Mike Crittenden
Desc: Blue Trip is a CSS framework that intends to offer web developers a 24 column grid layout, printing stylesheets, and form styling, all with a strong emphasis on typography to build upon for their website development projects.

Name: Cocos2d Scala Framework by Cocos2d
Desc: Cocos2d-x Scala framework intends to offera suite of open-source, cross-platform, game-development tools for developers. The framework focuses on back-end development to allow for more front-end software development.

Name: Cocos2d-Pure Swift Objective-C Framework by Cocos2d
Desc: The Cocos2d-Pure Swift Objective-C Framework is a free and open source 2D game development framework. It intends to provide node hierarchy for Cocos2d game application development.

Name: Base PHP SDK by Base
Desc: The Base PHP SDK by Base integrates customer relationship features into applications. Usage demonstrates how to build a client, interact with architecture, and handle errors.

Name: Bootstrap JavaScript Framework by Mark Otto and Jacob
Desc: Bootstrap is a Framework for developing web projects with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Bootstrap can scale websites and applications across different devices, such as phones and desktops. It is designed for projects of all sizes and developers of all skill levels.

Name: Broilerplate CSS Framework by BroilerPlate
Desc:
The Broilerplate CSS framework's goal is to bring a lighter version of the Blueprint CSS framework, with the intent to allow for more freedom for developers in the overall design and development of websites.
The idea is to contribute more basic grids, typography, and stylesheets without the suggestion of un-semantic naming conventions.

Name: Emastic CSS Framework by Emastic
Desc: Emastic is a CSS Framework that aims to offer various features to enhance CSS grids, and develop a baseline typography for web applications.

Name: Baseline CSS Framework by Baseline
Desc: Baseline is a CSS framework that intends to offer a platform for developing a website with a focus on grid aesthetic and well developed typography. The framework's goal is to start with several files in order to reset the browser’s default behavior, build a basic typographic layout — including style for HTML forms and new HTML 5 elements — and build a simple grid system.

Name: Cocos2d Python Framework by Cocos2d
Desc: Cocos2d is a Python framework for building 2D games, demos, and other graphical/interactive applications. It aims to provide some conventions and classes to help with the structure of a "scene based application", including a workflow connecting the different scenes.

Name: FakeItEasy .Net Framework by FakeItEasy
Desc: The FakeItEasy .Net Framework by FakeItEasy allows developers to create fake objects, mocks, stubs, etc. This .Net framework is compatible with both C# and VB.Net.

Name: Apache Hadoop Java Framework by Apache
Desc: Apache Hadoop aims to be a framework for running applications on a large cluster of commodity hardware. The Hadoop framework intends to provide applications with reliability and data motion by offering a computational paradigm named Map/Reduce, which is an application that is divided into many small fragments of work, each of which can be executed or re-executed on any node in the cluster. The framework also aims to provide a distributed file system (HDFS) that stores data on the compute nodes, providing very high aggregate bandwidth across the cluster.

Name: Scoobi Scala Framework by Nicta
Desc: Scoobi is a Scala framework library that intends to facilitate the productive building of Hadoop applications. It allows for the functional programming of Scala.

Name: ScalaBlitz Scala Framework by ScalaBlitz
Desc: ScalaBlitz is a scala framework that intends to provide efficient sequential and data-parallel collections for application development and testing.

Name: Cocos2D-XNA Java Framework by Cocos2D-XNA
Desc: Cocos2D-XNA is a 2D/3D game development framework, written specifically for XNA. The framework offers support to other platforms than deprecated Microsoft XNA targets such as the MonoGame runtime.

Name: BlueOak Server Node.js Framework by BlueOak
Desc: BlueOak Server Node.js Framework by BlueOak is swagger-matic, that is, it maximizes the value of the Swagger-enabled API by using it to drive runtime behavior. BlueOak Server loads the API, connects the paths it defines to developer's implementation code, exposes that API to the network; and validates that every request is well-formed, per that API.

Name: Less CSS Framework by Joni Korpi
Desc: The Less Framework is a CSS grid system that aims to assist developers with designing adaptive web sites. It intends to contain 4 layouts and 3 sets of typography presets, all based on a single grid.

Name: Ice Cream CSS Framework by Zied Hosni
Desc: The Ice Cream CSS framework intends to offer developers a basic grid layout with predefined classes for simple web pages. The framework presents a 12 column layout with responsive design options for multiple screen dimensions and an image wrapper with the goal to minimize grid development from scratch.

Name: Formee CSS Framework by Bernard De Luna
Desc: Formee is a CSS framework that presents developers with stylized HTML and CSS for most forms on web pages. The framework's goal is to offer web developers and designers with options to customize or to use without additions.

Name: 52 Framework CSS Framework by Angel Grablev
Desc: The 52 CSS framework intends to provide a grid system for HTML5 form validation and update to standards in web development, CSS3 and HTML5.

Name: ScalaMeter Scala Framework by ScalaMeter
Desc: The ScalaMaster framework aims to provide aicrobenchmarking and performance regression testing framework for the JVM platform.

Name: 1kb CSS Framework by Grady Kuhnline
Desc: The 1kb Grid aims to be a tool that offers a CSS grid system, loosely based on 960 Grid system (of Nathan Smith). The framework intends to reduce the need for code writing and employment of streamlining CMS page templates all while aiming to be under 1kb.

Name: Unfiltered Scala Framework by Unfiltered
Desc: Unfiltered is a Scala framework that aims to provide servicing HTTP requests in Scala. It intends to offer a consistent vocabulary for handing requests on various server backends, without impeding direct access to their native interfaces.

Name: Concise CSS Framework by Concise
Desc: The Concise CSS framework is written in SASS with PostCSS plugins. It aims to be a lighter option to Bootstrap and Foundation by focusing on native HTML elements only. The intent is to render a lightweight framework with plug-in options to minimize the need to override the presented code. The framework proposes prebuilt yet customizable headers, forms, lists, print stylesheets, and grid layouts that are mobile responsive.

Name: 960 Grid System CSS Framework by 960 Grid System
Desc: The 960 Grid System aims to offer rapid prototyping, and integration into a production environment. The CSS framework intends to offer printable sketch sheets, design layouts, and a CSS file that have identical measurements.

Name: Xitrum Scala Framework by Xitrum
Desc: Xitrum aims to be an async and clustered Scala web framework and HTTP(S) server that is a fusion on top of Netty, Akka, and Hazelcast frameworks.

Name: Spray Scala Framework by Spray
Desc: Spray is an open-source Scala framework that aims to provide a toolkit for building REST/HTTP-based integration layers on top of Scala and Akka. The framework intends to offer an asynchronous, actor-based, fast, lightweight, modular and testable platform.

Name: Socko Scala Framework by Vibul
Desc: Socko an open source, lightweight and embeddable Scala framework that intends to offer web servers that can serve static files and support RESTful APIs to our business logic implemented in Akka.

Name: Skinny Scala Framework by Skinny
Desc: Skinny is a full-stack Scala framework built on Skinny Micro. The framework's intended concept is Scala on Rails, inspired by Ruby on Rails and allowing for sustainable productivity on Servlet-based web app development.

Name: Total Node.js Framework by Totaljs
Desc: The total.js framework aims to be a web application framework for creating web sites and web services using JavaScript, HTML and CSS. The framework does not have any dependencies and is written from the scratch.

Name: Telsajs Node.js Framework by Tesla.js
Desc: Tesla is a MVC style framework that aims to offer a framework that is built on top of Node.js and Express. The framework intends to offer expedited option to configure web applications, with structured defaults and flexible boilerplates.

Name: Riot JavaScript Framework by Riot
Desc: Riot is a JavaScript framework that intends to provide custom tags to modern browsers with virtual DOM and custom syntax. The goal is to allow for a smaller learning curve with a mirco framework.

Name: Hypo JavaScript Framework by Ryan Lynch
Desc: Hypo aims to be a dependency Injection for JavaScript by using a xml configuration file that outlines all the "beans" and dependencies in an application. The intention is to create a configuration object that defines "entities" and dependencies in one location to be retrieved the hypo instance. Hypo intends to support many Spring features such as transient entities, lazy entities, abstract entities, parent entities, and factories.

Name: Chibi JavaScript Framework by Kyle Barrow
Desc: Chibi intends to be a micro JavaScript framework that offers lighter CSS coding for web applications, to help with narrow bandwidths and diverse browsers.

Name: Riloadr JavaScript Framework by Túbal Martín
Desc: The Riloadr framework intends to provide a cross-browser framework that offers an independent and responsive image loader written in Javascript.

Name: Mag JavaScript Framework by Magnumjs
Desc: Mag intends to be a semantic data binding framework that uses normal HTML as a template and a related module (plain JS object) as instructions for transpiling/interpolations for JavaScription applications.

Name: TinyView JavaScript Framework by Narendra Sisodiya
Desc: The TinyView JavaScript framework aims to offer developers tools to use the "V" in MVC. The framework intends to offer a highly focused for SubView and Memory Leaks for MVC applications written in JavaScript.

Name: Vert.x Groovy Framework by Vert.x
Desc: Vert.x is a tool-kit framework that aims to provide reactive web applications on the JVM. It has a variety of language options such as Java, Groovy, Ruby and JavaScript.

Name: PowerVR JavaScript Framework by Imagination
Desc: The PowerVR Framework aims to be a cross-platform and cross-API framework that acts as a scaffold for developers to build a rendering or game engine. It features different modules at varying levels of abstraction.

Name: Connexion Python Framework by Zalando
Desc: Connexion is a framework on top of Flask that aims to provide to handle a REST API requests based on OpenAPI 2.0 Specification (formerly known as Swagger Spec) files in YAML.

Name: Spark Java Framework by Spark
Desc: Spark Framework aims to be a simple and lightweight Java web framework built for rapid development. Spark's intention to provide a pure Java alternative for developers are seeking to develop web applications in Java.

Name: Dropwizard Java Framework by Dropwizard
Desc: The Dropwizard framework aims to provide the development of ops-friendly, high-performance, RESTful web services. The framework aims to pull together stable, mature libraries from the Java ecosystem into a simple, light-weight package. Dropwizard has features such as support for configuration, application metrics, logging, operational tools, and much more.

Name: Kyro Java Framework by Esoteric Software
Desc: Kryo aims to be an object graph serialization framework for Java. The goals of the project are speed, efficiency, and an easy to use API. The project intends to be useful any time objects need to be persisted, whether to a file, database, or over the network.

Name: Netty Java Framework by The Netty Project
Desc: The Netty framework's goal is to provide a NIO client server framework which enables quick development of network applications such as protocol servers and clients. It aims to greatly simplify and streamline network programming such as TCP and UDP socket server.

Name: Vert.x Ruby Framework by Vert.x
Desc: Vert.x is a tool-kit framework that aims to provide reactive web applications on the JVM. It has a variety of language options such as Java, Groovy, Ruby and JavaScript.

Name: Cucumber Java Framework by Cucumber
Desc: Cucumber aims to provide a platform to build various types of software. The framework features updated documentation, automated testing, and specification testing.

Name: Vert.x JavaScript Framework by Vert.x
Desc: Vert.x is a tool-kit framework that aims to provide reactive web applications on the JVM. It has a variety of language options such as Java, Groovy, Ruby and JavaScript.

Name: Derive4j Java Framework by Derive4j
Desc: The Derive4j framework's goal is to provide a Java 8 annotation processor and framework for deriving algebraic data types constructors, pattern-matching, morphisms, (near future: optics and typeclasses).

Name: Checker Java Framework by Checker
Desc: The Checker Framework aims to enhance Java’s type system to make it more powerful and useful. This allows for software developers to detect and prevent errors in Java programs. The Checker Framework intends to include compiler plug-ins ("checkers") that find bugs or verify.

Name: Axon Java Framework by Axon
Desc: The Axon framework's goal is focused on creating a java application based on the CQRS principles. The framework in intended to be used in many of environments and offer full scalability.

Name: Vert.x Java Framework by Vert.x
Desc: Vert.x is a tool-kit framework that aims to provide reactive web applications on the JVM. It has a variety of language options such as Java, Groovy, Ruby and JavaScript.

Name: Hibernate JavaScript Framework by Mallikarjun Sannapyati
Desc: Hibernate is an open source Java ORM framework that aims to provide data query and retrieval facilities that intends to reduce development time. The goal of the framework is to avoid the boilerplate code caused by using JDBC and SQL.

Name: HK2 Java Framework by Oracle
Desc: HK2 is a light-weight and dynamic dependency injection framework. Some of the things that can be done with HK2 are custom lifecycles and scopes, events, AOP and other proxies, custom injection resolution, and more.

Name: Dagger 2 JavaScript Framework by Google
Desc: The Dagger 2 framework intends to provide a compile-time evolution approach to dependency injection. The frameworks aims to eliminate all reflection, and improve code clarity by removing the traditional ObjectGraph/Injector in favor of user-specified Component interfaces.

Name: Guice Java Framework by Google
Desc: The Guice framework intends to alleviate the need for factories in Java code. The frameworks still allows for the need to write factories in some cases, but code will not depend directly on them to promote ease of use.

Name: DeltaSpike Java Framework by Apache
Desc: Apache DeltaSpike is framework library that intends to provide a collection of portable CDI extensions. It provides ready-to-use modules that can enable developers to integrate tested API extensions into Java projects.

Name: Singularity Java Framework by HubSpot
Desc: Singularity is a web application that aims to provide a platform for running and scheduling Apache Mesos tasks including long running processes, scheduled jobs, and one-off tasks.

Name: Aurora Java Framework by Apache
Desc: Apache Aurora is a framework that aims to provide a service scheduler that runs on top of Apache Mesos, enabling developers to run long-running services that take advantage of Apache Mesos’ scalability, fault-tolerance, and resource isolation.

Name: Orika Java Framework by orika-mapper
Desc: Orika is a Java Bean mapping framework that aims to recursively copies data from one object to another. It is intended to be useful when developing multi-layered applications.

Name: Tryton Python Framework by Tryton
Desc: The goal of the Tryton Python Framework is to provide functionalities for a complete application framework. It's features include data persistence, extensive modularity, users management (authentication, fine grained control for data access, handling of concurrent access of resources), workflow and report engines, web services and internationalisation.

Name: Spring Java Framework by Amaresh Agasimundina
Desc: Spring framework is an open source application framework that intends to provide key features such as the “IOC (Inversion Of Control) and AOP (Aspect Oriented Programming)”. The Framework aims to be a comprehensive programming and configuration model for modern Java-based “enterprise applications.”

Name: Reactive Scala Framework by nafg
Desc: Reactive is a Scala framework that offers a library framework for reactive web routing and web UIs.

Name: Colossus Scala Framework by Tumblr
Desc: The Colossus framework intends to offer a lightweight Scala framework for building applications in Scala that require non-blocking network I/O. The framework aims to maximize performance while keeping the interface clean and concise.

Name: Pychievements Python Framework by Packet Perception
Desc: Pychievements is a framework that aims to create and track achievements within a Python application. It intends to include functions specifically for to create command line applications yet also flexible enough to be used for web applications.

Name: Chaos Scala Framework by Mesosphere
Desc: Chaos aims to provide developers with a lightweight framework for writing REST services in Scala.

Name: Finatra Scala Framework by Twitter
Desc: Finantra is a production use as Twitter’s HTTP framework written that intends to offer feature and integration test support as well as optional JSR-330 Dependency Injection using Google Guice for Scala applications. The framework aims to provide a Jackson based JSON parsing to support required fields, default values, and custom validations.

Name: 3DModelComposer JavaScript Framework by PS WebDev
Desc: 3DModelComposer JavaScript Framework by PS WebDev allows developers to create galleries of customizable 3D models. It gives users a way to build models using parts & modifiers that the developers prepared.

Name: Chai JavaScript Framework by Chai.js
Desc: Chai is a JavaScript framework that intends to offer a BDD / TDD assertion framework library for node that can be paired with any javascript testing framework.

Name: Pluma C++ Framework by Gil Costa
Desc: Pluma is an open source C++ framework that aims to provide support for plug-in management.

Name: Mantra PHP Framework by Mantra
Desc: The OWASP Mantra PHP framework aims to be a security framework that intends to have a collection of free and open source tools integrated into a web browser for penetration testers, web application developers, security professionals as well as others.

Name: Pomegranate PHP Framework by Mehran Ziadloo
Desc: Pomegranate framework intends to provide a library of code written in PHP and Javascript to help developers create Ajax-based web applications easier. It is based on: PHP5.3+, Javascript, HTML5 and Zend Framework.

Name: Neuroph Java Framework by Sourceforge
Desc: Neuroph is lightweight Java neural network framework that aims to provide a way to develop common neural network architectures. It is described as containing an open source Java library with small number of basic classes which correspond to basic NN concepts. Also provides a GUI neural network editor to create Java neural network components.

Name: Websloit PHP Framework by Fardin Allahverdinazhand
Desc: WebSploit is a MITM Framework that aims to provide a security testing platform. The PHP based framework offers several features such as fake access point attack, web killer attack, bluetooth POD attack as well as others.

Name: Hcon Security Java Framework by Hcon
Desc: The Hcon Security Framework is written in Java and aims to provide a semi-automated secutiry testing platform. It intends to provide features such as web penetration testing, web exploits development, and open source intelligence.

Name: WHOA PHP Framework by Dradis
Desc: WHOA is a complete O-O MVC component and event-driven web application framework currently written for PHP with ports for Java, Python and ASP.NET scheduled.

Name: PureMVC Java Framework by PureMVC
Desc: PureMVC is a lightweight framework that offers developers a tool to create applications based upon the classic Model-View-Controller design meta-pattern. The framework provides a Java port of the AS3 reference implementation of the Standard Version. It does not support modular programming since it uses Singletons as Core actors rather than the Multitons used in the MultiCore Version.

Name: LOGBack Java Framework by Quality Open Software
Desc: Logback is a Java framework that intends to offer a generic architecture that is divided into three modules that build to create a basic framework for web development.

Name: Java Object Diff Framework by Daniel Bechler
Desc: The Java-Object-Diff framework is a Java library that intends to find differences between Java objects as well as merge them together. The framework aims to operate by taking two objects to generate a representational tree structure that highlights any differences between the objects and their children. The aim of the framework's tree structure is to extract more information or apply changes to the underlying data structures.

Name: Prerender Java Framework by Prerender
Desc: Prerender is a Java Framework that aims to use a java filter that prerenders a javascript rendered page and returns the HTML to a search engine crawler to facilitate SEO.

Name: LibGDX Java Framework by LibGDX
Desc: ibGDX is a cross-platform Java game development framework based on OpenGL (ES) that works on Windows, Linux, Mac OS X, Android, your WebGL enabled browser and iOS. The framework aims to provide an environment for rapid prototyping and iterations for developers.

Name: Restlet Java Framework by Restlet
Desc: The Restlet Java framework allows for routing and filtering for their client and server Java API. The aim is to provide secure and scalable RESTful web APIs.

Name: Spring Boot Java Framework by Spring
Desc: Pivotal Software offers developers a production-grade applications and services. The Java framework aims to provide features such as a range of non-functional features that are common to large classes of projects (e.g. embedded servers, security, metrics, health checks, externalized configuration) as well as no code generation and minimal XML configurement.

Name: Vaadin Java Framework by Vaadin
Desc: The Vaadin Framework, written in Java, intends to allow for the building of single page web apps in server-side Java or any other JVM language. It also offers automated browser-server communication and DTOs. for you.

Name: PrimeFaces Java Framework by PrimeTek
Desc: PrimeFaces is a lightweight Java framework that offers developers one jar, and no configuration or required dependencies.

Name: Wicket 7 Java Framework by Apache
Desc: Apache Wicket, a Java and componet based web application framework, offers proper mark-up/logic separation, a POJO data model, and aims to lessen the use of XML.

Name: Pippo Java Framework by Decebal Suiu
Desc: Pippo is an open source (Apache License) micro web framework written in Java that intends to offer minimal dependencies. The goal of the project is to create a micro web framework in Java that faciliates eas of use and hacking.

Name: JADE Java Framework by Jade
Desc: JADE (Java Agent DEvelopment Framework) is a software Framework that intends to offer the implementation of multi-agent systems through a middle-ware that complies with the FIPA specifications and through a set of graphical tools that support the debugging and deployment phases.

Name: Apache Tapestry Java Framework by Apache Tapestry
Desc: Apache Tapestry aims to offer a component-oriented framework for creating highly scalable web applications in Java.

Name: Selenium Java Framework by Selenium
Desc: Selenium aims to offer browswer automation. The framework intends to automate web applications for testing purposes, however it also aims to be versitle with other tasks that can be automated.

Name: Truth Java Framework by Google
Desc: The Truth Framework by Google aims to offer developers an assertion/proposition framework appropriate for testing. The framework is inspired by FEST.

Name: Junit JavaScript Framework by Junit
Desc: JUnit is a JavaScript framework that allows developers to write repeatable tests. It is an instance of the xUnit architecture for unit testing frameworks.

Name: Spock Java Framework by Spock
Desc: Spock is a testing and specification framework for Java and Groovy applications. It aims to offer highly expressive specification language and is compatible with most IDEs, build tools, and continuous integration servers. Spock is inspired from JUnit, jMock, RSpec, Groovy, and Scala.

Name: Panada3D Java Framework by Panda3D
Desc: Panda3D intends to provide a game engine framework for 3D rendering and game development for Python and C++ programs. Panda3D aims to be Open Source and free for any purpose, including commercial ventures.

Name: PyUnit Python Framework by Python
Desc: The Python unit testing framework aims to a Python language version of JUnit, by Kent Beck and Erich Gamma. JUnit intends to provide a Java version of Kent’s Smalltalk testing framework. Each is the de facto standard unit testing framework for its respective language.

Name: GPU iOS Framework by Brad Larson
Desc: The GPU iOS Framework by Brad Larson is a BSD-licensed iOS framework that lets developers apply GPU-accelerated filters and other effects to images, live camera video, and movies. In comparison to Core Image (part of iOS 5.0), GPUImage allows for writing custom filters.

Name: DPark Python Framework by Douban
Desc: The DPark framework is written in Python and aims to be like frameworks such as Spark, MapReduce(R) to offer computing framework supporting iterative computation.

Name: Context Python Framework by Benjamin Hodgson
Desc: The Contexts Python Framework aims to be a 'Context-Specification'-style test framework for Python 3.3 and above. It aims to be flexible, extensible and appropriate for unit, integration, and acceptance testing.

Name: Robot Python Framework by Robot Framework
Desc: The Robot Framework aims to be a generic open source test automation framework for acceptance testing and acceptance test-driven development (ATDD). the framework uses tabular test data syntax while offering developers keyword-driven testing approach. The testing capabilities intends to be extended by test libraries implemented either with Python or Java, and users can create new higher-level keywords from existing ones using the same syntax that is used for creating test cases.

Name: Play Scala Framework by Play
Desc: The Play framework offers developers a lightweight, stateless, web-friendly architecture. Built on Akka, Play aims to provide predictable and minimal resource consumption (CPU, memory, threads) for highly-scalable applications.

Name: Jogger Java Framework by Elibom
Desc: Jogger is a Java a micro-web framework that intends to provide a way of creating web applications programatically. Jogger integrates popular frameworks (Express.js, Ruby on Rails, Sinatra and Flask) for Java environments.

Name: Sweet Scala Framework by SweetScala
Desc: SweetScala is a framework written in Scala that offers developers a web application framework to building dynamic web content that runs on various Java servers. The framework aims to provide the option to run on a Java Virtual Machine to use Java based libraries, servers, and large communities.

Name: Scalatra Scala Framework by Scalatra
Desc: Scalatra is a web micro-framework written in Scala. It intends to combine the power of the JVM with Scala, allowing for high-performance web sites and APIs.

Name: Lift Python Framework by Lift
Desc: The Lift framework aims to provide secure development platforms for developers. The framework offers scalability, modular designs, and other features. The framework is written in Python.

Name: Mocha Node.js Framework by Mochajs
Desc: Mocha aims to be a feature-rich JavaScript test framework that runs on Node.js and browsers. The framework allows for asynchronous testing that runs serially for reporting, while mapping uncaught exceptions to test cases.

Name: Ezel Node.js Framework by Artsy
Desc: Ezel aims to provide a boilerplate for Backbone projects that share code server/client, render server/client, and scale through modular architecture. The framework is used at Artsy to bootstrap new projects.

Name: Tower Node.js Framework by Tower
Desc: Tower is a Node.js framework that offers small components for building apps, manipulating data, and automating a distributed infrastructure.

Name: Sequelize Node.js Framework by Sequelize
Desc: Sequelize is a Node.js/io.js ORM that aims to be suited for Postgres, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite and Microsoft SQL Server. It aims to feature transaction support, relations, read replication and more.

Name: Wintersmith.js Node.js Framework Johan Nordberg
Desc: Wintersmith is a simple yet flexible static site generator. It takes contents (markdown, less, scripts, etc), transforms them using plugins and outputs a static website (html, css, images, etc) that you can host anywhere.

Name: Sixpack Node.js Framework by SeatGeek
Desc: Sixpack is a Node.js framework that offers an A/B testing across multiple programming languages. The framework exposes an API for client libraries and contains two features: Sixpack-server which facilitates the responding to web requests as well as Sixpack-web, a web dashboard for tracking and acting on your A/B tests. Sixpack-web is optional.

Name: Frisby.js Node.js Framework by Vance Lucas
Desc: Frisby is a REST API testing framework that intends to be built on node.js and Jasmine that facilitates API endpoint testing. The framework requires Node.js and NPM for installation.

Name: Wheels Node.js Framework by Stanislav
Desc: The Wheels Node.js Framework aims to offer an object-oriented web framework that is written in CoffeeScript.

Name: Axt Node.js Framework by Gabriel Reiser
Desc: The AXT framework intends to provide an extendable javascript framework for working both in Node.js and browsers. The frameworks aims to be for MVC appilcations in Node.js and client side servers.

Name: Flask Python Framework by Armin Ronacher
Desc: Flask is a Python microframework that aims to be based on Werkzeug, Jinja 2.

Name: Meryl Node.js Framework by kadirpekel
Desc: Meryl aims to be a minimalist web framework for Node.js platforms that offers modication and minimal code.
