Name: Bobo Python Framework by Zope Foundation
Desc: Bobo aims to be a light-weight framework for creating WSGI web applications. It intends to offer mapping URLs to objects and calling objects to generate HTTP responses.

Name: Cyclone.io Python Framework by Alexandre Fiori
Desc: Cyclone provides developers with a web server framework for Python that implements the Tornado API as a Twisted protocol.

Name: Omni Node.js Framework by Kevin Bedi
Desc: Omni.js is written in Node.js and offers a Backbone.js framework for real-time app development. The framework aims to provide models, collections, and events on the server, and automated permissions for clients.

Name: Itty Python Framework by Daniel Lindsley
Desc: Itty is a Python framework that aims to provide a micro-framework that is influenced by Sinatra. The framework intends to support routing, basic responses, HTTP status codes, files uploads, static media serving as well as others.

Name: CherryPy Python Framework by CherryPy
Desc: CherryPy allows for the building of web applications in a manner similar to building other object-oriented Python programs. This intends to permit a smaller source code.

Name: Bottle Python Framework by Marcel Hellkamp
Desc: Bottle intends to offer developers a lightweight WSGI micro web-framework for Python. The frameworks aims to be distributed as a single file module with no dependencies other than the Python Standard Library.

Name: Polpetta Node.js Framework by Andrea Giammarchi
Desc: Polpetta is a script that aims to be able to initialize a node.js server in any folder you want and behave like CGI or PHP. This aims to provide a not static file serving only as well as dynamic content.

Name: Nombo Node.js Framework by Jonathan Gros-Dubois
Desc: Nombo is an Open Source Node.js framework that allows for the building of highly scalable, rich cloud applications.

Name: Seki Node.js Framework by Danny Ayers
Desc: Seki is a Node.js framework that aims to operate as a Web server. The framework intends to build queries from HTTP requests and transporting to the SPARQL server, formatting the results (to HTML, JSON, and others) and passing them back to the client.

Name: Protos Node.js Framework by derDesign
Desc: Protos is a Web Application Framework for Node.js that runs on Linux, FreeBSD & OSX.

Name: Rapid Rest Node.js Framework by Jason Rudland
Desc: Rapid Rest is a Node.js framework that intends to offer developers a minimal overhead Node.js REST server.

Name: Impress Node.js Framework by Timur Shemsedinov
Desc: Impress is a Node.js framework that intends to offer developers an application server for Node.js. The framework offers features such as; no callback chain; hierarchically inheritable hash routing instead ;monolithic high coupling core with obligatory things optimized for performance as well as many others.

Name: Spludo Node.js Framework by DracoBlue
Desc: The Spludo Node.js Framework aims to be a high performance, evented, server side, prototype based, javascript MVC web framework. It intends to offer DI+AOP and a Convention-Over-Configuration Approach.

Name: Web Node.js Framework by Will Wen Gunn
Desc: Webjs is a JavaScript framework that uses Node.js as a means to offer developers websites' and web apps' with a server-side script that is more stable and more readable.

Name: Bone Node.js Framework by Brad Carleton
Desc: Bone.io allows for the building of real time HTML5 apps using web sockets to deliver "hot" data to a browser. This aims to provide a construct rich, highly responsive user interface for developers.

Name: Pintura Node.js Framework by Kris Zyp
Desc: Pintura aims to be a cross-platform, server side JavaScript based REST architecture web framework that uses standards based in HTTP client/server interaction with a focus on JSON formatted data. The framework allows for the use of a RESTful HTTP/JSON interface to data,that can create data models and automatically provide a HTTP interface. In further aims to provide reusable CommonJS modules and JSGI middleware to be used on a JSGI compliant JavaScript platform, but tested on NodeJS and RingoJS.

Name: Fortune Node.js Framework by Fortune
Desc: Fortune is a Node.js framework the aims to offer an application system for Node.js & web browsers. It intends to provide a data access layer (adapter), business logic layer (transform), and presentation layer (serializer). These layers allow for multiple data sources to be exposed via multiple formats through a uniform interface.

Name: Flatiron Node.js Framework by flatIron
Desc: Flatiron is a Node.js framework that intends to offer a built collection of decoupled, unobtrusive tools that can operate in unison and independently. It aims to promote code organization and sustainability by clearly separating development concerns.

Name: MEAN.JS JavaScript Framework by MEAN.JS
Desc: The MEAN.JS JavaScript Framework by MEAN.JS is designed to help developers build and maintain web applications using MongoDB, Express, AngularJS, and Node.js.

Name: SimpleS Node.js Framework by Micleușanu Nicu
Desc: simpleS is a web framework for Node.JS that is aimed to be designed for the creatation of HTTP(S) servers and clients with features such as routing for http requests, static files, and errors, unique interface for requests and responses, and virtual hosting as well as others.

Name: HTML9 JavaScript Framework by Louis Lazaris
Desc: The HTML9 JavaScript Framework by Louis Lazaris is a flexible, dependency-free, lightweight, device-agnostic, modular, baked-in, component framework MVC library designed to allow for a responsive CSS-based app architecture.

Name: MicroBees JavaScript SDK by MicroBees
Desc: The MicroBees JavaScript SDK by MicroBees provides integration with an Internet of Things system to existing JavaScript applications. It can be used to connect with all of MicroBees' products.

Name: RestMVC Node.js Framework by Keith Larsen
Desc: The goal of RestMVC is to provide a simple framework that assists deveopers to write a RESTful webservice using NodeJs, Express, Mongoose, and MongoDB. It's goal is to take out the repetition of code writing and allow for application development.

Name: Ni Node.js Framework by Chetan Surpur
Desc: The Node.js framework Ni intends to offer a structure for organizing a application project and a file structure separated into models, views, controllers, libraries and helpers.

Name: Tachi Node.js Framework by Ed
Desc: Tachi aims to provide developers with accelerated application development tools. The framework intends to offer an inital node.js MVC app, using a view syntax and an ASP.NET MVC-style project layout. Tachi aims to provide rapid development with an expandable feature set, and additional support of features to achieve that goal.

Name: Roosevelt Node.js Framework by Eric Newport
Desc: Roosevelt aims to be a web application development framework based on Express. Roosevelt intends to abstract all boilerplates necessary to build a typical Express app and provide a uniform MVC structure for application development.

Name: Grasshopper Node.js Framework by Chandra Sekar S
Desc: Grasshopper is a Node.js framework that offers web application development support. The framework provides features such as integrated support for dependency injection, filter for intercepting requests, supports basic and digest authentication, and the compression of static files.

Name: Twee.io Node.js Framework by Twee.io
Desc: Twee.io is a Node.js framework that offers developers conventions that will protect OOP and MVC maneer code from issues that arise in big projects and applications.

Name: Josi Node.js Framework by Matt Lee
Desc: Josi is a web framework for node.js that aims to be a MVC web framework (e.g. ASP.NET MVC, Rails, Django). It allows for common features with Node.js, such as its asynchronous, event driven nature, possible to utilitze.

Name: Spine JavaScript Framework by Spine JS Project
Desc: Spine is a lightweight MVC library for building JavaScript web applications. It intends to offer developers structure and an architecture that complements patterns such as de-coupled components and CommonJS modules to help with code quality and maintainability. The framework's library is written in CoffeeScript.

Name: Rappid Node.js Framework by Rappid
Desc: rAppid.js intends to offer developers a declarative javascript web application framework for rapid web application development. It allows for the use of XML to define the structure of the application and to configure components such as datasources or routes. The framework aims to work by allowing the XML (XAML) to be translated to javascript components during runtime to render itself as HTML5 DOM elements. The framework was initally designed as a pure client side javascript library, however, it now offers an expendable web server with a request pipeline and different request handlers.

Name: Raddish Node.js Framework by Jasper van Rijbroek
Desc: Raddish is an open-source NodeJS Framework that aims to provide a framework for modern web applications. The framework aims to be a design pattern based architecure that gives developers more flexibility in application development and features. It allows for what is written to be resuable and extensible pieces of code.

Name: Code Kart Node.js Framework by Yangjie Pro
Desc: Codekart is a Node.js framework that intends to havea very small footprint, built for Node.js developers who need a simple toolkit to create full-featured web applications. The framework allows for developers to use shared hosting accounts and clients with deadlines.

Name: Locomotive Node.js Framework by Jared Hanson
Desc: Locomotive is a framework that aims to bring structure and MVC patterns to web applications using Node and Express.

Name: Sleekjs Node.js Framework by Cubet Techno Labs
Desc: Sleek.js is an MVC Wrapper Framework implemented from Node.jS that aims to be built-in with base dependency on handlebars.js. The Sleek.js architecture allows developers to follow the common format of MVC to handle and build sites with pluggable modules & themes support.

Name: Trintejs Node.js Framework by Alexey Gordeyev
Desc: Trintejs is a MVC boilerplate framework for ExpressJS backed by CaminteJS and Bootstrap.

Name: Agni Node.js Framework by Lorenzo Tabacchini
Desc: Agni is a web framework built on top of Express, based on the principle of convention over configuration. It intends to allow for a thin layer of abstraction for route definition and directory organization, without giving up the full power and flexibility of Express. The framework does not include any database abstraction system, but leaves this choice to the developer.

Name: Compoundjs Node.js Framework by Anatoliy
Desc: Compoundjs is a MVC framework that aims to work on servers and browsers to build web applications to provide well-organized interfaces for Express compatible applications. The framework is a compound of three things: the Express framework, structure, and extensions.

Name: Geddy Node.js Framework by Geddy
Desc: Geddy is a Node.js framework that aims to provide a structured web framework for web development.

Name: Strapi Node.js Framework by Wistity HQ
Desc: Strapi aims to be an open-source Node.js rich framework for building applications and services. The framework allows for developers to write reusable application logic and spend less time on building infrastructure. The framework sits on top of Koa. It intends to combine small modules that work together to provide maintainability, and structural conventions to Node.js applications.

Name: Adnois Node.js Framework by Aman Virk
Desc: The Adonis framework is a MVC framework written in Node.js that intends to offer a customized resource for writing scalable applications by allowing for the defining of expressive routes and writing terminal commands.

Name: Koa Node.js Framework by Koajs
Desc: Koa aims to be an expressive HTTP middleware for node.js to make web applications and APIs less complicated to write. Koa's middleware stack flows in a stack-like manner, allowing developers to perform actions downstream then filter and manipulate the response upstream. Koa's use of generators also facilates readability and robustness to an application.

Name: Rhapsody Node.js Framework by RhapsodyJS
Desc: RhapsodyJS aims to be a HMVC framework that runs on top of Express 4 while also creating a RESTful API for models. Additionally, it supports sockets, middleware/policies system, and includes other features.

Name: Facet Node.js Framework by Facet
Desc: Provides extensible common utility classes for rapid JSON API development. Offers the following functionality for abstration of middleware specific code for framework agnostic use; handling of request/response lifecycle; built in CRUD functionality via find, findOne, create, update, delete functions for various resources.

Name: Sail.js Node.js Framework by Sail.js
Desc: The Sail.js Node.js Framework is designed to help developers create Node.js websites and applications. It provides methods for managing assets, uploading files, and managing features.

Name: Hapi Node.js Framework by Hapi
Desc: The Hapi framework's objective is to be a configuration-centric framework with built-in support for input validation, caching, authentication, and other essential facilities for building web and services applications. hapi enables developers to focus on writing reusable application logic in a highly modular and prescriptive approach.

Name: Pomelo Node.js Framework by NetEase
Desc: Pomelo offers developers a scalable game server framework for node.js. The framework provides the development framework and many related components, including libraries and tools. Pomelo aims to be suitable for real-time web applications; its distributed architecture makes pomelo scale differently than other real-time frameworks.

Name: Noder Node.js Framework by Nicolab
Desc: Noder Node.js framework aims to be a lightweight and flexible core to create a scalable API. Starting a project quickly with a modular API.

Name: Restify Node.js Framework by Restify
Desc: Restify is a Node.js framework that intends to offer a micro-framework for building REST APIs.

Name: Keystone Node.js Framework by KeystoneJS
Desc: KeystoneJS is a Node.js framework that intends to provide a content management system and web application framework built onexpress and mongoose. Keystone offers the ability to create web sites and application, and comes with an auto-generated Admin UI.

Name: Percolator Node.js Framework by Gregg Caines
Desc: Percolator aims to be a framework for building quality HTTP APIs in Node.js. It's features include quality, public-facing APIs, single page and mobile applications.

Name: Diet Node.js Framework by Ádám Halász
Desc: diet.js aims to be a modular node.js web framework that offers scalable application and API development.

Name: Restberry Node.js Framework by Mattias Eriksson
Desc: Restberry intends to provide a framework for setting up RESTful JSON APIs with NodeJS. It allows for the indentification of models and setup CRUD API calls without the need for code writing to write code. API calls handle and identify issues as well as issue necessary HTTP responses and alerts to debug error responses. Restberry also provides authentication and permission checks and throws appropriate errors.

Name: Loopback Node.js API Framework by StrongLoop
Desc: The Loopback Node.js API Framework by StrongLoop provides a dynamic open source Node.js framework optimized for building end-to-end APIs for mobile, web, and other devices. The Loopback framework offers a set of Node.js modules that can be used together or independently to build applications. Developers can connect to multiple data sources, write business logic in Node.js, glue on top of existing services and data, connect using JS, iOS & Android SDKs, and much more.

Name: Actionhero Node.js Framework by Evan Tahler
Desc: The Actionhero.js framework aims to be a multi-transport Node.JS API Server with integrated cluster capabilities and delayed tasks..

Name: COKE Node.js Framework by DreamersLab
Desc: The COKE Node.js framework aims to provide developers with a full stack MVC framework that expedites web development.

Name: SocketStream Node.js Framework by SocketStream
Desc: SocketStream aims to be a Node.js framework for realtime web applications.

Name: Chocolatejs Node.js Framework by JC Levy
Desc: Chocolatejs Node.js Framework aims to be a full stack and isomorphic Node.js web framework and online ide. The framework is an experimental Node.js web application framework built using Coffeescript.

Name: Mediator JavaScript Framework by Jack Lawson
Desc: Mediator is a JavaScript framework that intends to provide a class that allows a developer to register, unregister, and call subscriber methods to help event-based, asyncronous programming. The framework's purpose is to make the usage of WebSockets, Ajax calls, DOM events, or other asynchronous operations easy to maintain and test.

Name: Sane Stack Node.js Framework by Sane
Desc: The Sane Stack is a Node.js framework that offers developers a Sails and Ember cli to faciliate application development. This framework is cited as being an early prototype with further developments to come.

Name: Danf Node.js Framework by Gnodi
Desc: Danf intends to provide a javascript/node.js full-stack isomorphic OOP framework allowing to code the same way on both client-side (browser) and server-side (node.js). It provides many features to produce scalable, maintainable, testable and performant applications.

Name: Catberry Node.js Framework by Catberry
Desc: Catberry is a Node.js framework that offers developers Flux architecture, isomorphic web-components and progressive rendering.

Name: AllcountJS Node.js Framework by AllcountJS
Desc: AllcountJS Node.js Framework intends to provide an open source full-stack Node.js framework for application development. The framework's objective is to be designed to build production-ready web and mobile business applications. It offers business applications such for basic ones like CRUD as well as the more complex such as CRM, inventory, accounting and other enterprise systems that have domain objects with different views.

Name: Rococo JavaScript Framework by Rococo
Desc: The Rococo JavaScript Framework offers developers a strict subset of Javascript (BlackScript). BlackScript is like Javascript but has no:

Name: 140 Medley JavaScript Framework by Honza Pokorny
Desc: The 140 Medley JavaScript Framework by Honza Pokorny aims to be a micro-framework or a collection of small, helpful utilities for common javascript tasks.

Name: Koa Node.js Framework by Koa
Desc: Koa is a Node.js web framework that allows users to ditch callbacks and increase error handling by leveraging generators. It's designed by the same team that designed Express. Koa was made to be smaller, more expressive, and more robust.

Name: Janis JavaScript Framework by Janis
Desc: The Janis JavaScript frameworks aims to be a lightweight framework that provides animations via CSS transitions for modern browsers on the web as well as mobile devices. The goal of the framework is to organize commonly used methods of animating DOM elements in JavaScript.

Name: Lotus Ruby Framework by Luca Guidi
Desc: The Lotus Ruby Framework offers developers an Object Oriented Programming option to web development,

Name: Padrinorb Ruby Framework by Padrino
Desc: The Padrinorb ruby Framework's goal is offer developers core principles of the Sinatra Ruby Framework while creating a standard library of tools, helpers and functions that will make Sinatra suitable for increasingly complex applications.

Name: NYNY Ruby Framework by Andrei Lisnic
Desc: The NYNY Ruby Framework offers developers a micro web framework for testing applications on modern browsers. It's features include Rack middleware that allows for the use inside of Sinatra, Rails, and other Rack-based apps and being ~300 LOC in size.

Name: Grape Ruby Framework by Ruby Grape
Desc: The Grape Ruby Framework allows for the building of lightweight APIs with Ruby when a larger framework like Ruby on Rails isn't needed. It aims to be a REST-like API micro-framework built to work with existing web application frameworks by providing DSL to provide APIs. The framework's features include: built-in support for common conventions such as multiple formats, subdomain/prefix restriction, and versioning.

Name: Nancy Ruby Framework by Guillermo Iguaran
Desc: The Nancy Framework aims to be a minimal Ruby microframework for web development inspired in the Sinatra and Cuba frameworks. The framework's features include: routes such as support for get, post, put, patch, delete, options, head; set basic filters/callbacks with the before/after methods; and template rendering and caching through Tilt or ERB from stdlib.

Name: Stapes JavaScript Framework by Hay Kranen
Desc: The Stapes.js JavaScript framework aims to allow the design of an application to be objective on the setup and style of coding. The framework allows for developers to code using models, views and controllers, modules, jQuery, Zepto, React, and many others.

Name: Scorched Ruby Framework by Tom Wardrop
Desc: The Scorched framework is a Ruby framework that aims to be a generic, DRY, light-weight web framework for Ruby. It offers a generic set of constructs for processing HTTP requests, with websites and applications of different scales can be used to be built.

Name: Cuba Ruby Framework by Michel Martens
Desc: The Cuba Ruby Framework is a microframework that offers developers a mapper for Rack applications, inspired by Rum, a unified mapper for Rack applications.

Name: Wru JavaScript Framework by Andrea Giammarchi
Desc: Wru is a JavaScript framework that intends to offer an essential, general purpose test framework compatible with web environment, node.js,Rhino, and PhantomJS.

Name: Guggenheim JavaScript Framework by Will McKenzie
Desc: The JavaScript framework Guggenheim.js offers developers a framework for agnostic plugin to create interactive galleries. It uses CSS3 animation (with a fallback to Javascript) to create animated filtering, reordering and pagination of a gallery.

Name: PatternLab PHP Framework by Pattern Lab
Desc: The PHP version of Pattern Lab aims to be a static site generator. The framework combines platform-agnostic assets, like the Mustache-based patterns and the JavaScript-based viewer, with a PHP-based "builder" that builds the Pattern Lab site. By making it a static site generator, Pattern Lab aims to separate patterns, data, and presentation from build logic.

Name: Nerve JavaScript Framework by Jstandish
Desc: The Nerve JavaScript Framework by Jstandish aims to be an asynchronous javascript micro framework for event broadcasts along routes and channels.

Name: Styleguide Node.js Framework by Lars Kappert
Desc: The Node.js framework Style Guide aims to be a simple styleguide framework. It offers developers aninstall component-styleguide into a styleguide project with minimal impact. The frameworks realted to http://patternlab.io.

Name: Nuclear JavaScript Framework by Optimizely
Desc: The Nuclear JavaScript Framework by Optimizely aims to be a reactive flux built with ImmutableJS data structures.

Name: WebRx JavaScript Framework by WebRx
Desc: The JavaScript Framework WebRx aims to be a Javascript MVVM-Framework built on ReactiveX for Javascript (RxJs) that combines functional-reactive programming with Observable-driven declarative Data-Binding, Features also include templating and Client-Side Routing.

Name: JSBlocks JavaScript Framework by Antonio Stoilkov
Desc: The JSBlocks JavaScript Framework by Antonio Stoilkov offers developers a user interface for complex single-page applications using a server-side rendered framework

Name: Maria JavaScript Framework by Peter Michaux
Desc: The MVC framework is intended for JavaScript applications. The framework is aimed at developers who use real MVC such as The Smalltalk MVC and The Gang of Four MVC. The framework is written in JavaScript.

Name: Phaser JavaScript Framework by Richard Davey
Desc: The Phaser JavaScript Framework by Richard Davey is intended to be a free 2D game framework for making HTML5 games for desktop and mobile web browsers, supporting Canvas and WebGL rendering.

Name: Opentip JavaScript Framework by Matias Meno
Desc: The Opentip JavaScript Framework by Matias Meno aims to be a javascript tooltip. It offers uses for adapters to make the framework available for all major frameworks and provides a native adapter that works without a framework.

Name: Qunit JavaScript Framework by jQuery
Desc: The Qunit JavaScript Framework by jQuery aims to be a powerful JavaScript unit testing framework. The framework is intended for jQuery UI and jQuery Mobile projects and allows for testing generic JavaScript code including the framework itself.

Name: Derby JavaScript Framework by Derby
Desc: The Derby Framework offers developers a MVC framework to write realtime, collaborative applications that run in both Node.js and browsers.

Name: Mithril JavaScript Framework by Leo Horie
Desc: The Mithril JavaScript Framework by Leo Horie aims to be a client-side MVC framework, The framework offers developers a tool to organize code in a way that facilitates maintenance and organization.

Name: Aurelia JavaScript Framework by Durandal
Desc: The Aurelia Framework aims to be a library that offers part of the Aurelia platform and contains the aurelia framework which brings together all the required core aurelia libraries into an application-building platform.

Name: Noduino JavaScript Framework by Sebastian Müller
Desc: The JavaScript framework by Sebastian Müller allows for developers to create a JavaScript and Node.js Framework for accessing basic Arduino controls from Web Applications using HTML5, Socket.IO and Node.js.

Name: Prototype JavaScript Framework by Sam Stephenson
Desc: Prototype is a JavaScript framework that aims to ease development of dynamic web applications. It offers a familiar class-style OO framework, extensive Ajax support, higher-order programming constructs, and easy DOM manipulation.

Name: Babylon JavaScript Framework by Babylon
Desc: Babylon.js aims to be a complete JavaScript framework for building 3D games with HTML 5 and WebGL. A web browser is required to run the framework, and it currently supports Internet Explorer 11+, Firefox 4+, Google Chrome 9+, Opera 12+ and others.

Name: ColorBox JavaScript Framework by Jack Moore
Desc: The ColorBox JavaScript Framework by Jack Moore offers developers a customizable lightbox plugin for jQuery.

Name: Holder JavaScript Framework by Ivan Malopinsky
Desc: The Holder.js Framework aims to render image placeholders entirely in a browser. The framework offers customer colors, fonts, resizing behavior, and rendering engine.

Name: FlexSlider JavaScript Framework by WooThemes
Desc: FlexSlider JavaScript Framework aims to be a responsive Jquery slider toolkit. The framework offers developers support for all major browsers, callback API, multiple slider support, and customer navigation options.

Name: Interact.js JavaScript Framework by Taye A
Desc: The Interact.js JavaScript Framework aims to offer developers a testing environment that allows them to drop, resize and multi-touch gestures with inertia and snapping for modern browsers. Features include cross browser and device support, interaction with SVG elements, and others.

Name: Moobile JavaScript Framework by Moobile
Desc: The Moobile JavaScript Framework by Moobile aims to be a mobile application framework based on Mootools. The framework requires Safari or Chrome to be ultilized as well as a broiler plate for MooTools.

Name: Applcelerator Titanium Mobile JavaScript Framework by Appcelerator
Desc: The Titanium framework aims to provide a platform for web developers to build cross-platform, native mobile applications using JavaScript. Currently, Titanium supports mobile smartphone operating systems such as Apple iPhone, Google's Android, and Mobile Web. Other platforms, such as Windows Phone, are currently in development.

Name: Nightwatch JavaScript Framework by Nightwatch
Desc: The Nightwatch.js Framework aims to be a Node.js based End-to-End (E2E) testing solution for browser based apps and websites. It uses the Selenium WebDriver API to perform commands and assertions on DOM elements.

Name: Iconic JavaScript Framework by Iconic
Desc: Iconic JavaScript Framework by Iconic is currently free and open source. The framework aims to offer a library of mobile-optimized HTML, CSS and JS components, gestures, and tools for building highly interactive apps. It is built with Sass and optimized for AngularJS.

Name: EmbedJS JavaScript Framework by uxebu
Desc: EmbedJS is a JavaScript framework that aims to be targeted at embedded devices (mobile phones, TVs, etc.). The frameworks offers a different approach by shipping just the code needed for each device. This feature results in less code going over the wire and branching at runtime as well as less memory usage.

Name: Zepto JavaScript Framework by Thomas Fuchs
Desc: Zepto aims to be a minimalist JavaScript library/framework for modern browsers with a largely jQuery-compatible API. This requires Node.js installation prior to use.

Name: JQTouch JavaScript Framework by Sencha Labs
Desc: jQTouch is a JavaScript plugin/framework that aims to work with either Zepto.js or jQuery, and includes animations, navigation, and themes for mobile WebKit browsers (as found in iOS, Android, BlackBerry, and WebOS). Features includes customization, theme support, callback functions, Zepto integration and many others.

Name: PhoneGap JavaScript Framework by PhoneGap
Desc: PhoneGap JavaScript Framework aims to be an open source framework that allows developers to create mobile apps using standardized web APIs for platforms.

Name: Twelve-Space JavaScript Framework by Kevin Mack
Desc: The Twelve-Space JavaScript Framework by Kevin Mack aims to be a Sass-based, BEM, OOCSS framework for creating DOM modules. This framework is written in JavaScript.

Name: jQuery.my JavaScript Framework by ermouth
Desc: jQuery.my aims to be a plugin that binds HTML controls with underlying javascript object using declarative MVVM style manifest. Bindings are bi-directional and real-time. jQuery.my recognizes standard HTML controls as well as composite controls rendered by jQuery Mobile, nearly all jQuery UI widgets, Redactor, Ace, CodeMirror, Select2 and others.

Name: Chocolatechip-UI JavaScript Framework by Sourcebits
Desc: ChocolateChip-UI aims to be a JavaScript framework for making mobile Web apps. It has three components: semantic HTML5 markup, CSS and JavaScript. Using the framework requires a familiarity with JavaScript so users can utilize features such as templates, Ajax requests and handle callbacks for user interaction. ChocolateChip-UI requires jQuery.

Name: Watir JavaScript Framework by Watir
Desc: The Watir Framework aims to be an open-source (BSD) family of Ruby libraries for automating web browsers. It supports develper's apps regardless of the technology it is developed in. The framework supports testing in Internet Explorer on Windows, Firefox and Chrome on Windows, Mac and Linux.

Name: AngularJS JavaScript Router Framework by Angular-UI
Desc:
The AngularJS JavaScript Router Framework by Angular-UI is a de-facto solution to flexible routing with nested views for the AngularJS API. This routing framework allows users to organize parts of interfaces into a state machine. The states are bound to named, nested and parallel views, allowing for powerful management of the user's application interfaces.
The AngularJS API allows developers to access and integrate the functionality of AngularJS with other applications and to create new applications.

Name: Zombiejs JavaScript Framework by Assaf Arkin
Desc: Zombie.js aims to be a lightweight framework for testing client-side JavaScript code in a simulated environment. Its biggest feature is that is does not require a browser for testing. Installation requires oi.js.

Name: Yeti JavaScript Framework by YUI
Desc: Yeti aims to be a Framework that tests frameworks. It allows for the automation of testing for various test frameworks. Yeti attempts to test a dev box (where it works by itself) to a CI system (where it launches browsers with Selenium) without changing existing tests. The framework requires Node.js.

Name: Raptorjs JavaScript Framework by Raptorjs
Desc: The RaptorJS aims to be a JavaScript module bundler that also provides first-level support for delivering JavaScript, CSS, images and other assets to the browser. Supported optimizations: Bundling, Code splitting, Lazy loading, Compression, and several others.

Name: Casperjs JavaScript Framework by Nicolas Perriault
Desc: CasperJS aims to be a navigation scripting & testing utility for PhantomJS and SlimerJS. The framework facilitates the process of defining a full navigation scenario and provides functionality, methods & syntaxic sugar for doing common tasks. Such tasks include: defining and ordering navigantion steps; filing forms, clicking links, capturing screenshots, logging events and several others. This framework is written in JavaScript.

Name: Karma JavaScript Framework by Karma Runner
Desc: The aim of the Karma JavaScript Framework is to bring instant feedback testing to developers. Its features include: testing on real devices, remote workflow control, continuous integration, and others.

Name: Phantomjs JavaScript Framework by Ariya Hidayat
Desc: PhantomJS aims to be a headless WebKit that is scriptable with a JavaScript API. Its features include native support for various web standards: DOM handling, CSS selector, JSON, Canvas, and SVG. PhantomJS can be used to test workflow of various open-source projects: Bootstrap, CodeMirror, Ember.js, jQuery Mobile, Less.js, Modernizr, YUI3, and others. The framework is written in JavaScript.

Name: State Machine JavaScript Framework by Jake Gordon
Desc: The State Machine Framework offers developers a standalone javascript micro-framework that provides a finite state machine. This framework is written JavaScript.

Name: Unsematic CSS Framework by Nathan Smith
Desc: The Unsematic CSS Framework by Nathan Smith aims to be a fluid grid for mobile, tablet, and desktop application developers.

Name: Groundwork CSS Framework by GroundworkCSS
Desc: The GroundworkCSS Framework allows for developers to use HTML5, CSS and Javascript toolkits. The Framework aims create accessible web apps that work on different devices.

Name: Tuktuk CSS Framework by Javi Jiménez
Desc: The Tuktuk CSS Framework by Javi Jiménez allows for developers to create responsive front-end framework that creates extensible sites. Features include: CSS3 powered, and Object Oriented CSS: The aim of this framework is to encourage code reuse and create stylesheets that can be added to and maintained.

Name: xCSS JavaScript Framework by Anton Pawlik
Desc: The xCSS JavaScript Framework by Anton Pawlik aims to be a straightforward and object-oriented workflow when developing complex style cascades. It allows for developers to more easily develop and write CSS applications and includes a variety of other features.

Name: Fluidable CSS Framework by Andri Sigurðsson
Desc: The Fluidable CSS Framework by Andri Sigurðsson aims to be a mobile first, responsive grid system. It is standalone, lightweight & built using LESS.

Name: Ink CSS Framework by SAPO
Desc: The Ink CSS Framework by SAPO aims to be an HTML5/CSS3 framework for design and prototyping.

Name: Kickoff CSS Framework by Kickoff
Desc: The Kickoff CSS Framework by Kickoff aims to be a lightweight front-end framework for creating scalable, responsive sites.

Name: Cascade CSS Framework by John Slegers
Desc: The Cascade CSS Framework by John Slegers allows developers to split CSS into seperate files based on features rather than selectors as well as implementt a modifier design pattern inspired by SMACCS and OOCSS,

Name: Responsive Broilerplate CSS Framework by fernando monteiro
Desc: The Responsive Broilerplate CSS Framework by fernando monteiro aims to be a lightweight (3kb) cross browser grid system made with three main classes and 12 columns.

Name: Jeet CSS Framework by Mojo Tech
Desc: The Jeet CSS Framework by MojoTech aims to be a grid system with the option to integrate fractions (or float numbers) as context that generates a percentage based width and gutter for grids.

Name: Inuit CSS Framework by Harry Roberts
Desc: The Inuit CSS Framework by Harry Roberts aims to provide a scalable, Sass-based, BEM, OOCSS framework. The framework is geared toward being less code heavy, and for developers that are providing abstraction and an OO approach. the framework's features include: design patterns, nestable, fluid grids; a double-stranded heading hierarchy; sprites; buttons and others.

Name: Susy CSS Framework by Eric Suzzane
Desc: The Susy CSS Framework allows developers to make custom layouts with CSS. The framework requires Sass.

Name: TopCoat JavaSctipt Framework by TopCoat
Desc: TopCoat CSS Framework by TopCoat aims to be a BEM oriented, themeable and responsive framework written in CSS.

Name: Vert.x Core Framework by Vert.x
Desc: Vert.x Core is an open source framework for building responsive apps in the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). Vert.x Core is a suite of APIs that handle tasks like: writing TCP clients and servers, writing HTTP clients and servers, shared data, datagram Sockets, DNS client, file system access, clustering and more. Although based in Java, the Vert.x also offers idiomatic API equivalents in Ruby, JavaScript, Ruby and Groovy. See the project page for detailed descriptions of Vert.x's capabilities and full API documentation. The project is developed with the Eclipse Foundation and licensed under the Eclipse Public License 1.0 and Apache License 2.0.

Name: Cloud Elements Python SDK by MobileWorks
Desc: This is the Python SDK for Cloud Elements allowing developers to access and integrate the functionality of Cloud Elements with other applications through Python. Cloud Elements is an API management and integration platform that helps developers design, manage, and integrate their APIs.

Name: Common Works Registration Python Framework by Weso
Desc: This framework provides access to the Common Works Registration (CWR) through Python. CWR is the standard for registration and revision of musical works.

Name: Face++ iOS SDK by Face++
Desc: The Face++ iOS SDK by Face++ offers interaction with the API in Objective-C language with the goal to aggregate image recognition features into an Apple application. Resources include step by step instructions to integrate FacePlusPlus SDK into an iOS project. Text on GitHub available in English and Chinese.

Name: Eskimo Node.js Framework by Niftylettuce
Desc: The Eskimo Node.js Framework allows developers to create Node.js powered APIs, applications, and other Node.js products. Eskimo offers solutions and tools to developers to build APIs, applications, and more in Node.js.

Name: Crossroads Internet of Things iOS Framework by Feeney Wireless
Desc: Crossroads is an Internet of Things framework that aims to simplify big data. It is targeted to vendors, devices, and platforms. This framework in Objective-C is available contacting Feeney Wireless, a company based in Oregon, USA dedicated to facilitate the Internet of Things. For more information, visit http://feeneywireless.com/company/contact_us

Name: Crossroads Internet of Things Android Framework by Feeney Wireless
Desc: Feeney Wireless, known by providing Internet of Things services, recently released Crossroads, a framework that aims to simplify IoT for big data projects. The framework in Java language for Android development is available contacting the company at http://feeneywireless.com/company/contact_us

Name: PencilBlue Node.js Framework by PencilBlue
Desc: The PencilBlue Node.js Framework allows developers to access and integrate the functionality of PencilBlue with other applications. PencilBlue is a Node.js content management system for blogs and websites of all sizes.

Name: Mathjs Node.js & JavaScript Framework by Jos de Jong
Desc: The Mathjs Node.js and JavaScript Framework provides a math library for Node.js and JavaScript. Math.js provides a solution to integrate and work with big and complex numbers, units, and matrices in applications.

Name: PSX PHP Framework by PSX
Desc: The PSK PHP Framework aims to provide tools for routing, API versioning, data transformation, authentication, documentation and testing. PSX allows for the building of a REST API around an existing application or create a new one from scratch.

Name: TinEye Python Library by TinEye
Desc: TinEye offers reverse image search services to maintain a person's reputation or a brand's image. While match engine finds duplicate of an image, mobile engine connects the physical with the digital world using recognition capacities. This is the official Python library for the Commercial API, which allows to read and write data related to copyright compliance and image moderation.

Name: Spring Framework by Spring
Desc: The Spring Framework by Spring is a framework that provides developers with models for programming and configuration of Java-based enterprise applications. This framework also provides foundations for all of the other Spring projects.

Name: HiFramework PHP Framework by Diego Mariani
Desc: The HiFramework is a lightweight PHP framework built to create php applications.

Name: Meteor JaveScript Framework by Meteor
Desc: Meteor JavaScript Framework aims for building modern web applications. The Framework allows for With Meteor writing apps in pure JavaScript that send data over the wire instead of HTML using open-source libraries.

Name: TourCMS Angular SDK by TourCMS
Desc: TourCMS Angular.js SDK by TourCMS provides developers an Angular framework to work with the TourCMS API.

Name: Wee JavaScript Framework by Wee Power
Desc: The Wee JavaScript frameworks aims to be a mobile-first CSS framework with reset, base, and Less mixin library features. It is written in JavaScript.

Name: Cerebral JavaScript Framework by Christian Alfoni
Desc: The Cerebral JavaScript Framework aims to be a skeleton framework for application development. The framework is currently in the preview phase. It is written in JavaScript.

Name: Zikula PHP Framework by Zikula
Desc: The Zikula PHP Framework by Zikula offers a web based application framework, fully extensible by modules, plugins and themes. It is written in PHP.

Name: Symfony PHP Framework by SensioLabs
Desc: The Symfony PHP Framework by SensioLabs aims to provide a standard foundation for building PHP applications.

Name: BEAR.Resource PHP Framework by BEAR.Sunday
Desc: The BEAR.Resource aims to be a Hypermedia framework that allows for resources to behave as objects. Features include allowing objects to have RESTful web service benefits such as client-server, uniform interface, statelessness, resource expression with mutual connectivity and layered components. The Framework is written in PHP.

Name: BearSunday PHP Framework by BearSunday
Desc: The BEAR.Sunday PHP Framework aims to be a resource orientated framework with a REST centered architecture, implementing Dependency Injection and Aspect Orientated Programming' at its core. The frameowrk is written in PHP.

Name: Furtive CSS JavaScript Framework by Jon Otander
Desc: The Furtive CSS JavaScript Framework by Jon Otander is a JavaScript framework that allows for application developement using CSS.

Name: T3 JavaScript Framework by Box
Desc: T3 JavaScript Framework aims to be a client-side JavaScript framework for building large-scale web applications. Its design is based on the principles of Scalable JavaScript Application Architecture. It is written in JavaScript.

Name: iCloudDocumentSync Framework by iRare Media
Desc: The iCloudDocumentSync project by iRare Media integrates iCloud into iOS documents. With this framework, users are able to sync, upload, manage, and remove documents from iCloud. The idea is to simplify the process. Sam's project features drag and drop from iCloud framework, delegate methods, iOS sample app, and frequent updates. Developers are invited to contribute to his work.

Name: Deployd JavaScript Framework by Deployd
Desc: The Deployd JavaScript Framework by Deployd aims to be an API building tool that provides ready-made functionality. This framework is written in JavaScript.

Name: Diffbot Dart Client by Diffbot
Desc: This Diffbot Client by Diffbot supports Dart programming language interaction with Diffbot APIs.

Name: Mezzanine CMS Framework for Django by stephenmcd
Desc: The Mezzanine CMS Django framework provides MVC architecture, ORM, tempting, caching, automatic admin interface, hierarchical page navigation, save in draft or preview, schedule publishing, drag-and-drop page ordering, WYSIWYG editing, in-line page editing, drag-and-drop HTML5 forms builder with CSV export, SEO friendly URLs and meta data, shopping card module, multiple integrations, and customization features for the Mezzanine API.

Name: Materialize JavaScript Framework by Materialize
Desc: The Materialize JavaScript Framework was created and designed by Google, Material Design is a design language that combines principles of design. Google's goal is to develop a system of design that allows for a unified user experience across all their products on any platform.

Name: Docker Remote PHP SDK by Stage1
Desc: This is a PHP SDK for working with Docker's API. Docker offers an open platform for distributed app development. This PHP SDK is still under development, and does not yet support all features of the API. Installation via Composer is recommended. See the documentation for versioning information and info regarding the further development of the SDK.

Name: Kohana PHP Framework by Kohana
Desc: The Kohana PHP Framework by Kohana is a web development framework that allows for the building of applications. The framework is written in PHP5.

Name: Sails Node.js Framework by Balderdash
Desc: The Sails framework is a web framework that allows developers to build custom, enterprise-grade Node.js apps. It aims to resemble the MVC architecture from frameworks like Ruby on Rails, but with support for the more modern, data-oriented style of web app development. This Framework is for Node.js.

Name: Play Java Framework by Play
Desc: The Play Java Framework by Play allows for a high-productivity Java web application framework that integrates the components and API for web application development. The framework is written in Java and is available in Scala.

Name: Phalcon PHP Framework by Phalcon
Desc: Phalcon PHP Framework by Phalcon is an open source, full stack framework for PHP written as a C-extension, optimized for high performance. Phalcon is loosely coupled, allowing for objects as glue components based on the needs of an application.

Name: Sensu Ruby Framework by Sensu
Desc: The Sensu Ruby Framework by Sensu is an open source framework that aims to provide a monitoring framework. By providing an agent, message bus, & event processor, Sensu enables developers and operations teams to compose telemetry systems to meet business specifications.

Name: Cloudmade Geocoding Static Framework by Landon Fuller
Desc: Cloudmade Geocoding is a system that provides predictive learning, map data enrichment, and navigation & guidance in connected cars. Cloudmade blog encourages users to work with a static framework available on developer's Landon Fuller site. This framework includes links, sections, and archives. This work was created to interact with iPhones.

Name: Flickr iOS Framework by David Casserly
Desc: The Flickr iOS framework by David Casserly has been created to access the Flickr API just like the currently used gallery pro iPad app. With this framework, users have two options to call methods: by string or by classes. It does not support Mac OS X. Available usage with API notes and authentication. Developers will be able to load interesting photos using the generated Flickr API model classes. This framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: Cloudmade Geocoding Mac OS Framework by Apple
Desc: The Cloudmade Geocoding API supports connected car content features such as map portals and driver analytics. This OS framework created by Apple can be useful for developers who want to build in Xcode to automate structures for Cloudmade according to their blog. Available directory, configuration, and compatibility.

Name: Ensembles Core Data iOS Framework by Drew McCormack
Desc: The Ensembles Core Data iOS Framework by Drew McCormack aims to extend Apple's Core Data framework to add peer-to-peer synchronization for Mac OS and iOS. Multiple SQLite persistent stores can be coupled together via a file synchronization platform like iCloud or Dropbox. The framework can be readily extended to support any service capable of moving files between devices, including custom servers. It is written in Objective-C.

Name: PSX PHP Framework by Christoph Kappestein
Desc: PSX is a framework written in PHP to create RESTful APIs. It provides tools to handle routing, API versioning, data transformation, authentication, documentation and testing. With PSX, developers can build an REST API around an existing application or create a new one.

Name: ROAD iOS Framework by EPam Systems
Desc: The ROAD iOS Framework by EPam Systems is a set of reusable components taking advantage of extra dimension Attribute-Oriented Programming adds. This framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: iOS Charts Framework by Daniel Cohen Gindi
Desc: The iOS Charts Framework by Daniel Cohen Gindideveloping is for both platforms, as the learning curve is singleton- it happens only once, and the code stays very similar so developers don't have to go around and re-invent the app to produce the same output with a different library. This framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: CocoaLumberJack iOS Framework By CocoaLumberJack
Desc: The CocoaLumberJack iOS Framework By CocoaLumberJack is a logging framework for Mac and iOS. Written in Objective-C.

Name: Slim PHP Framework by Slim
Desc: Slim is a lightweight micro framework that developers can use to build web applications and RESTful APIs in PHP. Features include a router, a resource locator and DI container, template rendering with custom views and more.

Name: Mantle iOS Framework by Mantle
Desc: The Mantle iOS Framework by Mantle is a model framework for Cocoa and Cocoa Touch. It is written in Objective-C.

Name: UiImage iOS Framework by Mad Dog Software
Desc: The UiImage iOS Framework by Mad Dog Software has IOS UIImage processing functions using the vDSP/Accellerate framework for speed. The framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: AFNetworking iOS Framework by AFNetworking
Desc: The AFNetworking iOS Framework by AFNetworking is a networking library for iOS and Mac OS X. It's built on top of the Foundation URL Loading System, extending high-level networking abstractions built into Cocoa. It has a modular architecture with well-designed, feature-rich APIs. The framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: DFImage Manager by Alexander Grebenyuk
Desc: The DFImage Manager by Alexander Grebenyuk is an iOS framework for loading, caching, processing, displaying and preheating images. The framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: GPUImage iOS Framework by Brad Larson
Desc: The GPUImage framework is a BSD-licensed iOS library that allows developers to apply GPU-accelerated filters and other effects to images, live camera video, and movies. Further, GPUImage allows for writing custom filters, supports deployment to iOS 4.0, and has a simpler interface. This framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: WURFL PHP Framework by ScientiaMobile
Desc: The WURFL is a Device Description Repository (DDR), or framework that enables applications to map HTTP requests to a description of the capability of the mobile device that requests the page. This framework is written in PHP,

Name: AddThis Web Service Framework by AddThis
Desc: The AddThis Web Service Framework by AddThis describes the common properties of all the APIs available on http://api.addthis.com.

Name: Google BigQuery Go SDK by Google
Desc: This Go client is auto generated by Google for use with their APIs, including BigQuery. The BigQuery API harnesses Google's major processing power to quickly query append-only data tables with SQL-like commands. See the project documentation for details on installing the API and importing the Go client.

Name: Restkit iOS Framework by RestKit
Desc: RestKit is an Objective-C framework for iOS that aims to make interacting with RESTful web services in a simplified format. It combines HTTP request/response API with a object mapping system that reduces the need for code writing.

Name: eMobc iOS Framework by eMobc
Desc: The eMobc IOS Framework allows for the development of native apps based in XML.

Name: Facebook React Native Framework by Facebook
Desc: The Facebook React Native Framework by Facebook allows developers to build quality applications on native platforms using React and JavaScript.

Name: Nimbus iOS Framework by Jeff Verkoeyen
Desc: The Nimbus is an iOS framework is a whose feature based framework that allows for problem solving when developing iOS applications. The framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: PowerMock JavaScript Framework by Jayway
Desc: The PowerMock is a Java framework that allows you to unit test code normally regarded as untestable. PowerMock is a framework that extends other mock libraries such as EasyMock with more capabilities. PowerMock uses a custom classloader and bytecode manipulation to enable mocking of static methods, constructors, final classes and methods, private methods, removal of static initializers and more.

Name: Core Plot iOS Framework by Core Plot
Desc: The Core Plot is a plotting framework for Mac OS X and iOS. It provides 2D visualization of data, and is integrated with Apple technologies like Core Animation, Core Data, and Cocoa Bindings. The framework is written in Objective-C.

Name: eMobc Android Framework by eMobc
Desc: The eMobc Android Framework allows for the creation of native apps based in XML in Android. The framework is written in JavaScript.

Name: Box2D C++ Framework by Box2D
Desc: The Box2D C++ Framework is a 2D rigid body physics engine, written in C++ by Erin Catto. Box2D is developed on Windows using Visual C++. Ports are also available for Flash, Java, C#, Python.

Name: OAuth Django Framework by eofs
Desc: The OAuth Django Framework by eofs makes it easy for developers to access the OAuth API using the Django REST Framework. This framework requires Python 2.7 or 3.3, Django 1.7+, Django Rest Framework 3.1+, and OAuthLib 0.6.0.

Name: TouchXML iOS Framework by TouchCode
Desc: The TouchXML Framework is an iOS framework written in Objective-C as a replacement for Cocoa's NSXML* cluster of classes. It is based on the commonly available Open Source libxml2 library.

Name: Gem Bitcoin Python Library by BitVault
Desc: The Gem Bitcoin Python Library by BitVault allows developers to integrate the Gem Bitcoin API's methods into their Python applications.

Name: Sauce Labs PHP Framework by Sauce Labs
Desc: The Sauce Labs PHP Framework provides automated application testing. The SDK is written in PHP.

Name: WePay Python Framework by WePay
Desc: The Wepay Python Framework by Wepay allows developers to build on their API and add payments into applications. This framework is written in Python.

Name: USA ePAY Perl Framework by CPAN
Desc: The USA ePAY Perl Framework by CPAN is an online payment framework for USA ePay and a generic module for processing payments through online credit card processors, electronic cash systems, etc. This framework is written in Perl.

Name: Forge JavaScript SDK by Acision
Desc: Use this JavaScript SDK from Acision to add video and voice calling, messaging, content sharing, and other WebRTC capabilities into your web and mobile applications.

Name: Ionic Javascript Framework by Ionic
Desc: The Ionic Javascript Framework by Ionicis a HTML5 native app development framework that allows developers to build native-feeling mobile apps with web technologies like HTML, CSS, and Javascript. Ionic is focused mainly on the look and feel, and UI interaction of your app. Ionic recommends AngularJS in order to work at its fully. .

Name: Yii PHP Framework by Yii
Desc: The Yii PHP Framework by Yii is a free, open source project released under the terms of the BSD License. It provides Web application development framework written in PHP5 that promotes DRY design and allows for development. Yii works to streamline application development and helps developers with their application development.

Name: SendGrid SMTP PERL SDK sendgrid-perl
Desc: A PERL SDK for interfacing with SendGrid's SMTP API. This SDK provides a wrapper for custom SMTP fields as well as a way to manipulate filter and app settings. SendGrid is a cloud-based platform for sending and managing email, and generating email analytics.

Name: App.net Objective-C Framework
Desc: Use this framework for building iOS and OSX App.net applications. The framework offers 100% App.net and features and multiuser support. ADNKit's only external dependency is AFNetworking, a networking library. See the framework wiki for detailed installation and implementation documentation.

Name: Google Affiliate Network Java Library
Desc: The Google Affiliate Network Java Library allows developers to integrate Google Affiliate Network data into their Java applications. Developers can add the library to their projects in Maven or Gradle using the provided code, or they can download a zip file containing the required jars.

Name: Skeleton CSS Framework
Desc: The Skeleton framework allows developers a framework for smaller, responsive CSS projects that don't need the utility of larger frameworks. Skeleton only styles standard HTML elements and includes a grid. The framework offers itself as a starting point with with UI and roughly 400 lines of CSS unminified (with comments), and has no compiling or installing.

Name: Django Twitter API 0.2.1 Framework
Desc: This Python language framework allows interaction between Django model interface and Twitter API objects.

Name: LifePics Android SDK
Desc: The LifePics service provides photo finishing and printing, including online storage and sharing of images. The LifePics Android SDK provides tools that enable developers to integrate the LifePics OPEN (Open Photo Ecommerce Network) API into Android applications. This will allow select pictures to be printed automatically from within a user's Android application. The SDK requires a LifePics developer key for use, and supports Android 2.3.3 and later. Instructions detail how to install and implement the SDK using Android Studio.

Name: Django Python Framework
Desc: Django REST framework in Python language aims to facilitate the creation of Web APIs. The requirements to work with Django include Python 2.6.5+, 2.7, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4 and Django 1.4.11+, 1.5.5+, 1.6, 1.7. Installation options are available either by using pip or by cloning from GitHub. Django has been used by Mozilla and Eventbrite. To visualize how this framework can fit into a developer's practices, an example is available with steps to follow. Benefits to develop include community support, customization, and extensive documentation.

Name: Laravel PHP Framework
Desc: Laravel is a framework in PHP language that invites developers to contribute for continuous improvement. Resources aim to educate users to create projects. Documentation on the Laravel website demonstrates installation, configuration, routing, and controllers. Additionally, it displays authentication, events, localization, security, unit testing, and validation. These guides can help to develop original work or practice over projects like the ones presented in the website. Such examples include Laravel Art, Laravel Cashier, Laravel Homestead, and Laravel Website.

Name: Bloomberg Solaris Perl Library
Desc: This library allows developers using Solaris to create their Bloomberg API with Perl. Solaris developers should note that these libraries can only be used with the Bloomberg Server API and B-Pipe data feed products (not the Desktop API). The Bloomberg API provides free, unrestricted access to raw financial data on current market trades (either real-time or delayed), reference data on historical information, and records of intraday trading. As part of their Open Market Data Initiative the library is offered under a "free-use" license, which allows unrestricted access of the interface's header files, documentation, and programming examples.

Name: Gisgraphy
Desc: Gisgraphy is a framework that helps users integrate geocoding services into their Java applications and webservices. The data provided comes from GeoNames and OpenStreetMap. Users may also add their own data. Results from Gisgraphy can be output in XML, JSON, PHP, Python, Ruby, YAML, GeoRSS, and Atom.

Name: JAX-RS Java Framework
Desc: Java API for RESTful Services (JAX-RS) started as part of the Gen incubator, a community of developers who create projects for the general public. The website offers drafts of the API, specifications, and mailing lists to communicate with the expert group. The latest API proposals are available on the wiki site. Releases include JAX-RS 2.0, JAX-RS 1.1, JAX-RS 1.0, and JAX-RS 0.x. The newest version, JAX-RS 2.0, provides portable APIs to develop, expose, and access web applications in REST. Web resources and provider extensions are available. In the Java community site, users can view the different stages of the project along with links to access every result.

Name: dogpatch PHP Framework
Desc: Dogpatch is a framework designed to test HTTP-accessible APIs. The package is written in PHP using curl. The framework was originally created by the team at NodeSocket to help in testing the Commando.io API. The framework supports basic authentication, SSL support, custom requests, and redirection up to 10 levels.

Name: KrakenJs Framework
Desc: Kraken is a framework in Node.js language that assists in the application development process with security and scalability. Although this tool can be used independently, users can benefit from 4 modules that include Lusca, an application security, Kappa with NPM Proxy, Makara with Dust i18n, and Adaro with Js context. Using Kraken, example projects include a shopping cart, passport integration, localization, and A/B testing.

Name: Flask Python Framework
Desc: Flask is a micro framework for Python supported by a BSD license. The documentation available on the website or downloadable in PDF or zipped HTML, contains built in developer and debugger, integrated unit testing support, RESTful request dispatching, Jinja2 templates, support for secure cookies, and WSGI 1.0 compliance. Sources of the examples of a microblog and a twitter clone made with Flask can be found on redirected links to GitHub. To contribute as developer, improver, or debugger Flask can be contacted on the IRC channel, the Feedback website, and the issue tracker.

Name: REST.li Java Framework
Desc: Rest.li is an end to end framework optimal for building RESTful APIs. Some of the features of this framework combine approachable APIs for writing non-blocking client and server code using ParSeq, type-safe development using generated data and client bindings, and JAX-RS inspired annotation driven server side resource development. LinkedIn, the professional social media network, uses Rest.li due to its client-side load balance, consistency with services, and the development possibilities of new features. The requirements to work with Rest.li include Java 1.6+ and Gradle 1.8+ or SBT 0.13.0+. A step by step tutorial shows example source code, creation of server, and creation of client.

Name: Microsoft ASP.NET Web API Framework
Desc: Microsoft ASP.NET Web API is a framework in .NET language that aims to facilitate HTTP building services in browsers and mobile devices. Two installing options are available: visual studio express 2013 and visual studio 2013 community. With the goal to instruct developers about the possibilities of application development, a tutorial has been published with a downloadable complete project. This project includes the steps to create an API web assignment that returns a list of products using JQuery. The specifications of adding a model, adding a controller, calling the Web API, and running the application are available for practice. Besides the rehearsal part, the site offers the following resources: mobile clients, routing, OData, serialization, testing/debugging, error handling, authentication, security, and API reference.

Name: Fortune.js Framework
Desc: Fortune.js is a framework in Node.js language. This framework can prototype hypermedia APIs with JSON protocol. Some of the available resources include guides, docs, examples, and issue management. Particularly, the guide shows instructional procedures that help to create applications. For example, the specifications sections of defining resources, defining association between resources, before and after associations within resources, and advanced usage aim to differentiate the purpose of the framework. In this case, Fortune.js is not an MVC framework, but a JSON view response specified by the JSON API spec.

Name: Sinatra Ruby Framework
Desc: Sinatra is an open source framework in Ruby. It is a domain-specific language that aims to accelerate web application development. Sinatra 1.3.0 version offers the feature of a streaming API while digesting differences between evented and sequential Rack servers. To imagine the possibilities of development, readers should consider that Apple, BBC, LinkedIn, and GitHub are some of the companies that use Sinatra. A book written by Alan Harris and Konstantin Haase, "Sinatra: up and running" is available for purchase. This resource contains additional information related to installation, routing, application/delegation, modular applications, and implementation of a blog engine.

Name: Eskimo Node.js Framework
Desc: Eskimo is a framework that helps developers construct Node.js powered APIs, online retail stores, and other applications. Eskimo is a boilerplate framework, providing simple scaffolding for rapidly developing prototypes and minimum viable products. The framework depends on Mongoose for NoSQL, Jade for HTML, Bookshelf for MySQL/MariaDB/PostgreSQL, and less LESS as a pre-processor and for middleware routing. The framework is customizable with a configuration file that enables the developer to exclude unnecessary parts.

Name: Zend Framework
Desc: Zend is a Framework on PHP. Some of the features include security, modularity, and community. To start with Zend Framework 2, it is recommendable to run at least PHP 5.3.23 with Apache web server and MySQL via PDO extension. Resources include a getcomposer link to create a project from scratch using the skeleton application available on Github, modules to organize a main application specific within each module, routing and controllers to build an inventory, database to run SQL statements, styling to remove any copyright messages, and actions to store to the database.

Name: Restlet Framework
Desc: Restlet is a framework on Java. Some of the steps to interact with Restlet include concepts related to web browsers, REST architecture, virtual hosts, static files, and URI redirection. In particular, this RESTlet framework contains diverse features that could be useful to create, scale, and extend API development projects. Restlet provides Web API support with REST and HTTP concepts, tunneling service with any HTTP methods, and automatic processes with URI variables extraction. Configuration includes Java via RESTlet API and via XML/WADL files. To scale a project, the service supports non-blocking NIO modes, asynchronous request processing decoupled from IO operations, and fully multi-threaded design per-request resource.

Name: Freedomotic Framework
Desc: The Freedomotic Framework is an open-source, flexible, and secure development framework. It's functions can help in building and managing modern smart spaces for individuals and business users. Freedomotic's framework works to provide solutions to creating building automation systems, small retail environments and more, and has the ability to be integrated with other automated technologies.

Name: Express.js Framework
Desc: Expressjs.com is a framework in Node.js language. Thanks to the resources available that include an introductory guide, a general guide, and a community guide, Expressjs.com aims to facilitate development for desktop and mobile applications. The introductory guide offers installation, express generator, and FAQ. The general guide presents error handling, debugging express, express behind proxies, and middleware. The community guide is under the resources tab. It shows examples, issues, and a Google Group with over 5,000 discussions.

Name: SproutCore Framework
Desc: SproutCore is an open source framework on JavaScript. The origins of SproutCore go back to 2007, when the project was developed by Apple, inspired by Cocoa, and maintained by a growing community. This framework offers features to develop applications for web and mobile. Some of them include KVO, optimized view layer, 50,000 items with the same DOM, compliant with WAI-ARIA, and offline support via Apache and Cordova.

Name: Datumbox Framework
Desc: Datumbox Machine Learning Framework is written Java, which enables the development of Machine Learning and Statistical applications. With this framework, developers have access to a number of machine learning algorithms & statistical tests.

Name: Cake PHP Framework
Desc: Cake PHP is a framework that aims to build web applications with less code. Simplicity and easiness are the core values for this framework. In the site users can review the reasons why Cake PHP is convenient to create web applications. Some of the rationale includes quick development, clean MVC conventions, and a friendly MIT license. Clinic Finder, MapMe, and ScratchMIT are 3 examples that currently deploy the Cake PHP framework.

Name: Sencha Touch Framework
Desc: Sencha Touch is an HTML5 framework that helps to create mobile applications targeted to businesses. This framework provides over 50 built-in components, customized themes, and a built model view controller.

Name: Fat-Free Framework
Desc: Fat-Free is a framework on PHP. To develop applications, users can refer to the guide available on the site, that includes instructions for interact with routing engines, plug-ins, and framework variables.

Name: Flight Framework
Desc: Flight is a micro-framework on PHP that allows developers to create RESTful applications. Flight requires PHP 5.3 or greater and it is licensed by MIT.

Name: Guzzle Framework
Desc: Guzzle is a framework on PHP HTTP that allows to interact with web services. Guzzle's characteristics aim to simplify POST requests with pluggable HTTP handlers and synchronous/asynchronous requests. Components contain log, OAuth, cache, retry, and message integrity subscribers.

Name: Rico Framework
Desc: Rico is a framework on JavaScript that aims to ease interactive web application development. Drag-and-drop, HTML elements, and animation effects are some of the functions supported by this framework. Additionally, Rico offers grids that can be populated either with static content or dynamic content with AJAX. Translations to French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Russian, and Ukrainian are available.

Name: Prototype Framework
Desc: Prototype is an object-oriented framework on Javascript. It aims to facilitate web applications using class-style OO framework, Ajax support, and DOM manipulation.

Name: Atoms Neurospeech Framework
Desc: Atoms Neurospeech is a JavaScript framework inspired from Flex and Silverlight. Atoms offers one time/one way/two way bindings, component object model, one liner AJAX, customizable UI scopes, cascade selections, and ready to use line of business controls.

Name: Sencha Ext Framework
Desc: Sencha Ext is a framework on Javascript that can be used to build business mobile applications. Version 5 offers additional features such as tablet support, grid widgets, model-view architecture, 2 way data binding, routing, and session management.

Name: Chaplin Framework
Desc: Chaplin is a framework on Javascript that uses the Backbone.js library. With Chaplin, web application development should be easier due to the functionality, scalability, and accessibility offered on the site.

Name: Dojo Toolkit Framework
Desc: Dojo toolkit 1.10 is an HTML5 framework on Javascript for mobile application development. This framework allows developers to create apps in iOS 5+, Android 2.2+, Windows Phone 8+, Blackberry 6+, and Node.js 0.6 11+, 0.8 6+, and 0.10+.

Name: Sammy Framework
Desc: Sammy is a framework on Javascript. It is 16K compressed and 5.2 compressed and gzipped. This framework is built on plugins and adapters. It aims to extract developers' code into reusable plugins.

Name: Licas Framework
Desc: Written in Java and Android compatible, Licas allows you to build service-based networks. All of the main SOA features are included for distributed communications or architecture and additional packages allow for AI programming. Build lightweight networks of service-based components (SOA or Cloud). Programmable framework with many features - add/run services, add/search metadata, autonomous, agent-based, self-organizing and distributed communication. Java J2SE (1.5+) compatible. Communication includes XML-RPC, REST, HTTP and dynamic Web Services (SOAP). An 'All-in-One' GUI is a free tool, available from the DCS site and can be used to run all of the packages and separate modules. Alternatively, write programs using the stand-alone server, or by extending the open source classes. A p2p network can be setup requiring only the HTTP address and optional passwords. Example Apps are messenger, file sharing, web services, query. The code can also be used for more scientific programs. Sub-packages include text or query processing, or heuristic evaluation. A problem solver provides genetic algorithms and other AI algorithms, integrated into the whole system.

Name: Backbone Framework
Desc: Backbone is a framework on Javascript. It connects events, collections, and functions to existent APIs over a RESTful JSON interface.

Name: Can JavaScript Framework
Desc: Can is a framework on Javascript. It aims to build applications that are flexible, powerful, and fast. It's flexible because developers can reuse templates. It's powerful because the framework contains 2 RESTful models. And it's fast because the responsive widgets can be learned in a day.

Name: PyGtalkRobot Google Talk Python Framework
Desc: PyGtalkRobot is a Google Talk bot framework written in Python. This framework requires the user to have either Python 2.4+ or ActivePython. Its dependencies are xmpppy and pydns.

Name: Derby.js Framework
Desc: Derby.js is a framework designed for developers to create collaborative real time web applications. The MVC framework facilitates the creation of applications that serve in Node.js and the browser.

Name: Zendesk Framework
Desc: The Zendesk framework can be utilized to construct robust Zendesk-themed apps with the help of JavaScript APIs. Zendesk apps can enhance functionality such as ticket information, customer details, and time tracking.

Name: Garmin Connect IQ SDK
Desc: Connect IQ a platform for third-party developers to create apps for Garmin products, and the Connect IQ SDK gives developers the tools to build these apps. With Connect IQ developers can customize the user experience with new faces, use the sensors to accumulate data and metrics, create widgets for instant information tidbits, and create fitness-reflated lifestyle web apps. A preview of the SDK is now available to start building apps for Garmin wearable devices. Devices that are compatible with Connect IQ will be available early 2015, but until then, the simulator included in the SDK will provide a testing platform for what is being built.

Name: Algolia Rails Client
Desc: This Ruby on Rails gem allows developers to easily integrate Algolia into object relational mapping systems. The Algolia Search API can be implemented into web applications to reference a database to display a drop down of real time search results. The API supports quick faceted, full-text, and numerical search results.

Name: React Javascript Framework
Desc: React is a JavaScript framework that helps developers build user interfaces. It can easily serve as the "view" element in a model-view-controller (MVC) stack since it makes no assumptions about the rest of the stack. The library is declarative, lightweight, efficient, and flexible.

Name: GuildWars2::API
Desc: GuildWars2::API is a PERL library that provides a set of standard interfaces for interacting with the Guild Wars 2 API. This library was written in PERL 5.16.3, and users will need to have at least PERL 5.14.0.

Name: Feed.Fm Unity SDK
Desc: Feed.Fm offers Unity SDK, a kit that wraps the REST API for the Unity environment. Developers can find a sample scene in the website to become aware of the functionality. In this case, the quickest way to understand how the kit works is to install the package and open the sample in Assets/FeedFm Demos/PlayerScene.unity. Additional to a sample scene, users can find guides related to the Player GUI that includes initialization, rendering, and caveats.

Name: Splunk PHP SDK
Desc: The Splunk developer platform consists of three primary components: Splunkd, the engine; Splunk Web, the app framework that sits on top of the engine; and the Splunk SDKs that interface with the REST API and extension points.The Splunk SDK for PHP lets developers target Splunkd by making calls against the engine's REST API and accessing the various Splunkd end points such as custom search commands, lookup functions, scripted inputs, and custom REST handlers.

Name: GW2API by Frugghi
Desc: GW2API by Frugghi is an Objective-C framework for accessing the Guild Wars 2 API, especially for integration with iOS and OS X applications. The framework's prerequisites are OS X, iOS: 6.0+, and ARC.

Name: Durmand Priory
Desc: Durmand Priory is a framework written in Objective-C for accessing the Guild Wars 2 API. All of the API's endpoints are included in the framework, but it's still a work in progress.

Name: Meteor JavaScript Framework
Desc: Meteor is a service that allows users to build web applications. Some features of Meteor include application interoperability, data synchronization, and live page updates. The Meteor JavaScript Framework is an open source tool for developers to construct web apps purely using JavaScript.

Name: Ember JavaScript
Desc: Ember-Runtime is a framework that provides core functions for Ember including cross-platform functions, and support for property observing and objects. It's focus is on small size and performance. It is intended to be used in place of or along-side other cross-platform libraries such as jQuery. The core Runtime framework is based on the jQuery API with a number of performance optimizations.

Name: AngularJS
Desc: Google provides AngularJS, a framework that can help developers to extend an application in HTML using Javascript objects.
